bossDialog: (The Ent glares at you harshly before uprooting itself. A number of creatures jump out of its branches and attack alongside it!)
This is a sacred place. *creeeeeak* You need to leave.
You should not have come here. *creeeeeak*

cardBonuses.3: Your creatures recover 20% more {STAT_health} from {CONDNAME_BUFF_MEND}.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures with {CONDNAME_BUFF_MEND} take 10% less damage.

master.dialog: Ents possess extraordinary healing properties. I think it has something to do with their bark, but I can't say for sure.\n\nYou're going to need to focus all your effort on one Ent at a time in order to bring them down before they recover. Let's fight!
master.name: Birch

name: Ent

bossDialog: Out. Out! OUT! Get out of my hideout! It's where I keep all my things!! You can't have them!
What would you even do with this treasure, you wrinkly lump of meat? It's going to last longer than you are!
You were always going to die someday. But, thanks to your curiosity, your time is now!

cardBonuses.3: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_SILENCE} deal 15% less damage.
cardBonuses.6: Increases the duration of enemies' {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_SILENCE} debuff by 1 turn.
cardBonuses.9: After an enemy is afflicted with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_SILENCE}, one of its Spell Gems is Sealed.

master.dialog: Paragons are interesting creatures in the sense that they affect all the creatures on the battlefield - friend and foe alike. It takes some serious strategy to utilize their full potential, but hey, that's the kind of guy I am so it all works out. Your creatures don't stand a chance against the likes of me!
master.name: Unaxx

name: Paragon

bossDialog: Even if I lose here, I'll get you eventually. You can count on that.
It's a sad thing that your adventures have ended here!
To struggle against me is to struggle against the inevitable.

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures have a 10% greater chance to deal critical damage.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures deal 25% more critical damage.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures have a minimum 10% chance to deal critical damage.

master.dialog: Reapers can make quick work of just about any creature out there. They care little for an enemy's defenses - if their opponent starts to lose focus, Reapers will end them in the blink of an eye. Let's fight!
master.name: Brindrid

name: Reaper

bossDialog: (A huge ruffle of loose feathers and dust fly into the air as the Harpy tries to create a distraction. Wise to its tricks, your creatures intercept the attack!)
(Giving you an unnervingly sadistic look, the Harpy ruffles up its feathers and issues a shrill battle cry before diving head first at you!)
(The Harpy immediately starts shrieking at the top of its lungs as soon as it spots you. Your creatures immediately move forward to shut it up.)

cardBonuses.2: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_BLIND} deal 10% less damage.
cardBonuses.5: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_BLIND} take 10% more damage.
cardBonuses.8: Enemies' {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_BLIND} debuff lasts forever.

master.dialog: Harpies are nasty little creatures that take great satisfaction in plucking the eyes out of their enemies' skulls... usually, while their foes are still alive. Got time for a quick duel?
master.name: Jerky

name: Harpy

bossDialog: Hee hoo hee hoo hay ha hoo? Hee hee hoo! HEE HO!\n\n...nah, just kidding. Still gonna kill you though.
Uuughh... too many feel-goods... AAH! A GIANT PINK DRAGON! ATTACK!! ATTACK!!!
You better get the hee hoo outta here before I hoo hay ha ho your hoo haa right off!

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures' {CLASS_Nature} spells deal 10% more damage.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures' damaging {CLASS_Nature} spells ignore 10% of their enemies' {STAT_defense}.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures' {CLASS_Nature} spells have 10% additional {STAT_charges}.

master.dialog: Imps are all about casting spells that belong to the Nature class. The more of these spells, they cast, the stronger they become. Imps are especially fond of a spell called Shellburst - erm, Shellbust. This spell can tear through even the heartiest of foes. Let me show you the power of Imps!
master.name: Doctor Feelgood

name: Imp

bossDialog: (The Siren points at you and shrieks at the top of its lungs at deafening volume! Summoned by the sound, its allies soon appear to defend the treasure from you!)
Despoiler! Filth! Vermin! Begone at once!
Once I've slaughtered your pathetic pets, I'm going to show you how many things I can do with a knife!

cardBonuses.2: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_SLEEP} have a 25% chance to not wake up after they take damage from attacks.
cardBonuses.4: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_SLEEP} have a 25% chance to not wake up after they take damage from spells.
cardBonuses.7: Enemies' {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_SLEEP} debuff lasts forever.

master.dialog: When you hear the name "Siren", don't you think of some beautiful, mermaid-like creature that middle-aged weirdos would fawn over? Well, you won't find them like that in Rodia. Nope, no sir. Sirens are actually some of the ugliest little guys in the whole world. Here - see for yourself!
master.name: Anders

name: Siren

bossDialog: Ahh, perfect. I just finished forging some new weapons and armor. You'll make a fine test of their strength!
I hope you're a more worthy challenge than the last five weaklings who blundered in here.
May my blades be sharp. May my armor hold fast. May my wit be swift and my muscles swifter. May Gonfurian grant me glory this day.

cardBonuses.2: You gain 30% more {RES_BRIMSTONE} from battles.
cardBonuses.4: Increases the base amount of {RES_BRIMSTONE} gained from battles by 15.
cardBonuses.7: You have a 15% chance to gain double {RES_BRIMSTONE} from battles.

master.dialog: Minotaurs have some serious anger issues, but when it comes time for a battle, that's just fine with me. Let's see how your creatures stand up against my army of crazed berserkers!
master.name: Ogron

name: Minotaur

bossDialog: (A strange creature keeps rapidly changing between several disgusting, terrifying and outright obscene forms in a clear effort to scare you away. Too bad you're made of sterner stuff.)
(The form of Everett appears before you and begins to speak - not fooled in the slightest, you order your creatures to attack. The Shapeshifter quickly reverts into a battle form!)
(Wow, there's a LOT of treasure here! However, your surprise quickly turns to dismay as a large portion of the treasure quickly changes shape and attacks you!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures deal 10% more damage to creatures that are weak against their class.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures take 10% less damage from creatures that are strong against their class.
cardBonuses.8: Doubles the potency of these effects.

master.dialog: For Shapeshifters, it's always the best day of the year: Opposite Day! I can tell by the blank look on your face that you have no idea what I'm talking about, so let's get right into a battle so I can show you!
master.name: Rensole

name: Shapeshifter

bossDialog: CUUUUUURSEEE.... YOOOOOUUUUU....
TOOOMB ROBBERRRR.... GEEEET OOOUUUUUTTT....
YOOOUU DIIISTUUURB... YOOOUU WIIILL DIIIEEEE...

cardBonuses.2: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_CURSED} take 10% more damage from this debuff.
cardBonuses.4: When enemies take damage from {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_CURSED}, there is a 20% chance this damage will be doubled.
cardBonuses.7: Doubles the potency of these effects.

master.dialog: As clichÃ© as it sounds, Mummies cripple their enemies with powerful curses. They also talk a lot, but I honestly have no idea what they're saying since their bandages are always in the way. Mmmph-mmph-mmmmmph, and all that. Anyway, let's duel!
master.name: Ixeor

name: Mummy

bossDialog: (As you approach the treasure hoard, a Clutcher guarding one of the chests makes an obscene gesture at you. That was just uncalled for.)
(The Clutcher suddenly lunges at you, trying to grab you! One of your creatures instinctively deflects the ambush, and you prepare for battle!)
(You hear scuttling as a Clutcher rapidly walks down the wall on its appendages. It points at you, and a group of creatures attack at its command!)

cardBonuses.3: Your creatures have a 5% greater chance to Dodge attacks.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures have an independent 5% chance to Dodge attacks.
cardBonuses.9: When your creatures fail to Dodge attacks, they take 5% less damage.

master.dialog: If your team relies on dodging attacks, I'm afraid my Clutchers are going to dish out the ultimate punishment to you. Let's see what you've got!
master.name: Gringer

name: Clutcher

bossDialog: (The Phoenix spreads its wings and releases a furious, keening cry, the air warming around you! Its allies soon appear and attack alongside it!)
(You hear a loud shriek as a huge Phoenix swoops down from a hole in the ceiling and descends upon you!)
(You notice a few large eggs nestled among the treasure - unfortunately you seem to have noticed them a bit too late, as their Phoenix parent is now rather angry at your intrusion!)

cardBonuses.2: When your creatures are resurrected, they recover 10% more {STAT_health}.
cardBonuses.5: When your creatures are resurrected, they recover 10% more {STAT_health}.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures can now be resurrected a maximum of 15 times per battle.

master.dialog: Hello there! Care for a duel? I'm warning you, though: Phoenixes can never truly be killed. My party is practically invincible!\n\nNot convinced? Then let me show you firsthand the might of my Phoenixes!
master.name: Dazzess

name: Phoenix

cardBonuses.2: When you fight a Mimic, it has a 25% chance to start the battle with 1 {STAT_health}.
cardBonuses.4: After you defeat a Mimic, there is a 5% chance that a Treasure Golem will spawn.

master.dialog: SURPRIIIIIIIIIIIIIIISE! HAAAAAAAAHAHAHAHAHA!
master.name: Humanoid Kraynaks

bossDialog: Mages may have created me, but I will never stop delighting in watching them die. Now it is your turn.
You challenge me? You must have a death wish - I shall gladly grant it!
Your kind's ceaseless greed never fails to bring you to ruin.

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures' Spell Gems have 10% more {STAT_charges}.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures' Spell Gems have 1 additional {STAT_charge}.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures' Ultimate Spell Gems have 1 additional {STAT_charge}.

master.dialog: Djinns are powerful spellcasters who capitalize on casting multiple spells in quick succession. If you're unable to put a stop to them in time, they'll soon overwhelm your efforts and annihilate your creatures where they stand. Perhaps a demonstration is in order - let's fight!
master.name: Connor

name: Djinn

bossDialog: WOT are ya DOIN' in my 'OUSE?! I'll mosh yer ugly 'ead in!
Ya 'avin a laff? Ya startin' summat?! I'll fold yer in 'alf like a leaf I swear on me mum!
Ya scrawny lil RUNT! I'd eat yer, but yer so tiny I couldn't even pick me teeth with ya!

cardBonuses.3: Your creatures have 10% more {STAT_speed} while they're {ACTION_provoking}.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures have 10% more {STAT_speed} while they're {ACTION_provoking}.
cardBonuses.9: Your creatures have 10% more {STAT_speed} while they're {ACTION_provoking}.

master.dialog: Trolls are crafty creatures who employ all manner of tricks and traps to take down their foes. No strategy, regardless of how ruthless, is beneath a Troll - and that's why I like them so much!\n\nFight me!
master.name: Karm

name: Troll

bossDialog: I'M GONNA STAB YA! I'M GONNA STAB YA! I'M GONNA STAB YA!
Ooh, fresh meat, and I just got done sharpening my best knives! It's my lucky day!
You don't look like much. Whatever, I'll just chop you up and feed you to the hounds. Hold still!

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures deal 10% more damage to {CLASS_Chaos} creatures.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures deal 10% more damage to {CLASS_Chaos} creatures.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures deal 10% more damage to {CLASS_Chaos} creatures.

master.dialog: Carvers are all about the stab-stab-stab. They don't care much about who they hurt, either - even their own friends are prone to lose some blood every now and again. Anyway, let's have ourselves a duel, shall we?
master.name: Dice

name: Carver

bossDialog: Have you ever once stopped to consider the damage you've done to this world? I will pay it back unto you tenfold!
I take no pride in this violent action, but it is necessary. You wouldn't understand.
This alcove and everything within it is protected. I will not allow you to defile it.

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures take 15% less damage from attacks from {CLASS_Nature} creatures.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures take 15% less damage from attacks from {CLASS_Nature} creatures.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures take 15% less damage from attacks from {CLASS_Nature} creatures.

master.dialog: Dryads empower their allies' buffs to make them even stronger yet. Think your creatures can overcome my Dryads' magic? We shall see.
master.name: Ryd

name: Dryad

bossDialog: (The Raven yells out something in a language you don't understand. Suddenly, the Raven's allies magically appear by its side, ready to fight you!)
You think you know so much, but you are just a tiny fledgling to a world like this. Let me show you your place!
You're supposed to be a mage? Don't make me laugh. Let me show you how a REAL magic user fights!

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures have 5% more {STAT_intelligence}.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures have 5% more {STAT_intelligence}.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures have 5% more {STAT_intelligence}.

master.dialog: Any party that heavily relies on spellcasters should consider adding a few Ravens to the mix. These well-rounded sorcerers will make your spells even more powerful, allowing you to lay waste to your enemies. Let's have a duel so I can show you!
master.name: Dyvys

name: Raven

bossDialog: (An Amaranth floats atop the treasure hoard, seemingly guarding it; you can't be too sure, given how inscrutable these creatures are. Either way, you need to get past it!)
(The creature guarding the treasure gazes deep into your soul with its single eye. Evidently not liking what it found, it moves to attack! How rude!)
(You have to stop and recollect your bearings momentarily as a bizarre creature suddenly materializes in your path, as if it had always been there. It attacks just as quickly!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures have 5% more {STAT_defense}.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures have 5% more {STAT_defense}.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures have 5% more {STAT_defense}.

master.dialog: Amaranths have the best defense of any race in all of Rodia! Think you can beat me? I'll bet your creatures can't even scratch mine!
master.name: Jerex

name: Amaranth

bossDialog: (A large hairy creature sits on top of the treasure pile, scratching its chin thoughtfully as you approach. Suddenly, with speed you'd have thought impossible, it darts upright and challenges you!)
(The Aspect grumbles loudly as you draw near. It snaps its thick fingers loudly, and a group of its friends appear to attack you!)
(Twirling and swinging its staff around, it's clear that the Aspect doesn't want you getting near the treasure at all. You have your creatures mob it all at once!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures with {CONDNAME_BUFF_AGILE} have a 5% greater chance to Dodge attacks.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures with {CONDNAME_BUFF_AGILE} take 10% less damage.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures' {CONDNAME_BUFF_AGILE} buff lasts forever.

master.dialog: Aspects are one with nature. They exhibit a level of focus that is unmatched by any other creature in Rodia, allowing them to dodge even the most powerful of attacks. Your creatures don't stand a chance!
master.name: Tao

name: Aspect

bossDialog: (A quiet chittering soon turns into several shrieks, as a particularly large Bat on the ceiling summons its friends to attack you!)
(A very large Bat drops down from the ceiling and covers the treasure hoard with its wings, hissing loudly. Looks like it's a fight!)
(You barely duck in time as the sound of leathery wings heralds a bat swooping down upon you. Your creatures immediately retaliate!)

cardBonuses.3: Your creatures have 5% more {STAT_attack}.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures have 5% more {STAT_attack}.

master.dialog: Bats might not seem very dangerous on their own, but get enough of them together and you'll be in for a nasty surprise! Let's have a quick duel so I can show you!
master.name: Batley

name: Bat

bossDialog: BURN! BURN! BURN TO THE GROUND! BURN TO THE GROUND!
I'm gonna torch the lot of you! Bring it on!
Nice outfit. Would be a shame if it went up in flames while you were wearing it.

cardBonuses.2: Enemies take 15% more damage from {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_BURNED}.
cardBonuses.4: Increases the amount of {STAT_intelligence} added to the {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_BURNED} debuffs your creatures apply by 50%.
cardBonuses.7: Enemies' {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_BURNED} debuff lasts forever.

master.dialog: Efreets light their foes on fire and watch them die short but painful deaths. Allow me to demonstrate!
master.name: Histor

name: Efreet

bossDialog: Ahh, more slaves have come to add themselves to my collection. How generous of you to offer up your lives to me!
There's so much I could do once I've ripped your soul out of your body. Care to give me any ideas?
You and your creatures will make fine additions to my army of the undead.

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures' {CLASS_Death} spells deal 10% more damage.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures' damaging {CLASS_Death} spells ignore 10% of the enemies' {STAT_defense}.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures' damaging {CLASS_Death} spells have 10% additional {STAT_charges}.

master.dialog: Liches are powerful spellcasters who use their Death spells to bring decay and rot to all who oppose them. Let's see if you can handle them!
master.name: The Reverend

name: Lich

bossDialog: (Divine flames swirl around the room and soon coalesce into the form of a regal six-winged figure. Surging with energy, it charges right at you!)
From on high, your ordained punishment comes. Be still and you may yet die with your dignity intact.
No further, human. Your travels end here.

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures deal 10% more damage to {CLASS_Life} creatures.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures deal 10% more damage to {CLASS_Life} creatures.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures deal 10% more damage to {CLASS_Life} creatures.

master.dialog: Many people scoff at Angels, believing they're too basic to be useful in battle. I'll show everyone just how wrong they are. Let's start with you!
master.name: Engelin

name: Angel

bossDialog: (As you draw near the humanoid figure, her abnormal proportions rapidly become apparent. She turns around and prepares to fight you, her total lack of a face revealing her to be no ordinary human.)
(The Occultist points at you and emits some strange sounds, almost like speech but not quite. The intent is clear, however - you're going to have to fight to get the treasure.)
(You recognize the mage standing before you as one of the Occultists. Knowing well their formidable prowess with magic, you advance cautiously with your creatures.)

cardBonuses.3: Your creatures' {CLASS_Sorcery} spells deal 10% more damage.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures' damaging {CLASS_Sorcery} spells ignore 10% of their enemies' {STAT_defense}.

master.dialog: Occultists are some of the finest Sorcery-spellcasters in all the land. As an added bonus, they're easy on the eyes as well, eh?\n\n(Let's show this creep who's boss!)
master.name: Potrix

name: Occultist

bossDialog: (A particularly large pile of gold coins swells in size and pours away to the ground with a cascading clinking sound, as the serpentine form of a Dragon unwinds itself to protect its riches!)
(Baring its teeth, the Dragon unfurls itself up to full height and lets forth a blast of flame towards you; your creatures quickly grab you and get you out of the way before preparing to attack!)
(The Dragon coiled around the treasure hoard lets forth a loud, furious roar as you approach - its greed refusing to permit you any share of it at all!)

cardBonuses.3: Your creatures deal 10% more damage to {CLASS_Sorcery} creatures.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures deal 10% more damage to {CLASS_Sorcery} creatures.
cardBonuses.9: Your creatures deal 10% more damage to {CLASS_Sorcery} creatures.

master.dialog: Dragons are cunning creatures who punish enemies for taking certain actions. For that reason, it takes a brilliant strategy to overcome them. Do you have what it takes to defeat my Dragons?
master.name: Niklas

name: Dragon

bossDialog: (As you approach the treasure hoard, a well-disguised golem unfolds itself and begins to approach you menacingly. Time for a fight!)
(The Golem bashes its fists together repeatedly as an obvious threat. You're going to have to defeat it to gain the treasure it guards.)
(What you thought was a statue suddenly comes to life and stomps the ground powerfully, clearly warning you to approach no further. You're not giving up on that treasure, though!)

cardBonuses.3: You gain 30% more {RES_ESSENCE} from battles.
cardBonuses.7: Increases the base amount of {RES_ESSENCE} gained from battles by 15.
cardBonuses.11: You have a 15% chance to gain double {RES_ESSENCE} from battles.

master.dialog: Golems have a variety of different uses. Every strong team should include at least one Golem, I say. Allow me to demonstrate their power!
master.name: Orvus, Best Golemancer

name: Golem

bossDialog: I wonder what kind of sound you'll make when I tear your legs off!
I'm going to have fun playing with your broken corpse. Don't worry; I'll be gentle.
Once I'm done with you, they won't be able to identify what's left of you.

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures deal 5% more damage.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures deal 5% more damage.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures deal 5% more damage.

master.dialog: Each Devil specializes in destroying creatures that belong to a certain class. What's more, Krampus allows my other Devils to share their power so they can handle anything you throw their way. Let's fight - but be warned, this won't be easy!
master.name: Ashton

name: Devil

bossDialog: If you're not gone by the count of ten, I'm going to smear your brains all over the walls. ...TEN!
Now THERE'S a face that needs a good beating. You've come to the right place!
Oh great, a human. I thought I smelled somethin' rotten in here. Have at you!

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures' {CONDNAME_BUFF_SPLASH} buff deals 10% more damage to adjacent creatures.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures' {CONDNAME_BUFF_SPLASH} buff deals its damage to 1 additional enemy.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures' {CONDNAME_BUFF_SPLASH} buff has a 10% chance to activate twice.

master.dialog: There's not much to say about Brownies, really. They pack one hell of a punch with their oversized hammers. Actually, do you suppose it's their hammers that are oversized, or their bodies that are a bit on the smaller side? Anyway, let's see how they stack up against the likes of you!
master.name: Buster

name: Brownie

bossDialog: (Issuing several loud shrill screams, the Wyvern quickly summons the owners of the treasure hoard as you approach!)
(The Wyvern inhales deeply to issue forth one of its infamously deadly shrieks, but one of your creatures quickly throws a rock in its mouth. You press the advantage and attack!)
(Wyverns are known to have a love of shiny objects and treasures, and this one seems to have made quite a collection. You'll have to fight it to gain its wealth!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures take 5% less damage from spells.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures take 5% less damage from spells.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures take 5% less damage from spells.

master.dialog: Wyverns are the ultimate anti-spellcasters. If your creatures try to cast a spell, my Wyverns will swallow the magic whole and spit it back out, decimating your creatures in the process. Let's duel!
master.name: Therron

name: Wyvern

bossDialog: (A playful, almost child-like giggle sounds around the room as a gelatinous creature rises from the treasure. It approaches, smiling and with open arms... backed by some rather malicious-looking friends!)
(You hear a sound from above and quickly step out of the way as something slimy lands on the cavern floor with a loud splat. The Slime soon reshapes itself and advances upon you and your creatures!)
Geehehehehe... you play? Play me! Big fun! Gehehehehehe!

cardBonuses.2: Enemies that are {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_CONFUSED} have a 10% greater chance to {ACTION_attack} their allies.
cardBonuses.5: Enemies that are {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_CONFUSED} have a 10% greater chance to {ACTION_cast} harmful spells on their allies.
cardBonuses.8: After an enemy's {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_CONFUSED} debuff activates, the duration of this debuff increases by 1.

master.dialog: Slimes are generous little creatures who like to share their boons with their friends. They're also great at provoking enemies - just look at how punchable their faces are!\n\nLet's have ourselves a duel, shall we?
master.name: Slippy

name: Slime

bossDialog: (A wild blaze of colors suddenly plays out in your mind - you shake off the obvious distraction and order your creatures to attack the Unicorn that was hoping to catch you off guard!)
(As you approach the treasure, a Unicorn comes barreling out of nowhere, flanked by several other creatures! It's never your lucky day with these treasure hoards, is it?)
(The Unicorn guarding the treasure whinnies loudly and rears up on its hind legs in a majestic threat display. It's almost a shame to end the life of such a magnificent creature.)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures take 15% less damage from attacks from {CLASS_Life} creatures.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures take 15% less damage from attacks from {CLASS_Life} creatures.
cardBonuses.7: Your creatures take 15% less damage from attacks from {CLASS_Life} creatures.

master.dialog: Unicorns are valiant attackers that use their enchanted horns to unleash powerful restorative magic on their allies. While any party could benefit from having a Unicorn or two, I prefer to bring along a whole army of them. Let me show you what they can do!
master.name: Vitali

name: Unicorn

bossDialog: (You are briefly caught off guard as part of the wall in the room forms a face, and then detaches and flies right at you!)
I CAN'T BELIEVE I WAS LEFT BEHIND IN THIS TINY ROOM. I'M SO FRUSTRATED! I'LL THINK I'LL TAKE IT OUT ON YOU!
PASS WORD.\n\n(It must expect a password to grant access to the treasure. Not having a clue what the password is, you just decide to murder it instead.)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures take 10% less damage while they're {ACTION_provoking}.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures take 10% less damage while they're {ACTION_provoking}.
cardBonuses.7: Your creatures take 10% less damage while they're {ACTION_provoking}.

master.dialog: Thanks to their massive size, Doom Fortresses make great tanks, capable of drawing aggression away from weaker creatures so they can continue fighting uninterrupted. Let's see if you can get past my defenses!
master.name: Malleville

name: Doom Fortress

bossDialog: (Swirling clouds of gas coalesce around several nearby creatures. In a stumbling and drugged haze, they join the Smog in attacking you!)
(The Smog immediately begins attempting to flood the room with deadly gas. You weave a protective spell and signal your creatures to attack!)
(You smell toxins in the air, and quickly drink an antidote you had on hand. The source of the gas, clearly frustrated, appears and attacks!)

cardBonuses.3: Enemies take 15% more damage from {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_POISON}.
cardBonuses.6: Increases the amount of {STAT_attack} added to the {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_POISON} debuffs your creatures apply by 50%.

master.dialog: There's no way it's healthy for me to be around these Smogs all the time, but alas, I am the Master of Smogs and that is my fate. For your sake, I hope your creatures can hold their breaths long enough to make it through this battle!
master.name: Menos

name: Smog

bossDialog: (You feel your hair stand on end and hear the hum and crackle of electricity in the air as the Storm approaches! Get ready for a fight!)
Odd. Most humans usually run from me. You wanna fight? *KRA-BOOM*
Oh look, more future charcoal! *RUMBLE*

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures take 15% less damage from {CLASS_Nature} spells.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures take 15% less damage from {CLASS_Nature} spells.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures take 15% less damage from {CLASS_Nature} spells.

master.dialog: Storms are at their strongest when they're completely healthy. Admittedly, they lose a lot of their power early on in battle, but luckily for me, my Storms will finish off your creatures before that happens!
master.name: Stromblad

name: Storm

bossDialog: (Beautiful shards of an almost crystal, almost metal substance whirl around the chamber, soon pulling themselves together into a form resembling a suit of armor. It blocks the way to the treasure!)
(The Phase Warrior silently raises its weapon as you approach it. Looks like it has no intention of allowing you to get the treasure.)

(What you thought was a particularly ornate shield in the treasure hoard separates into several shards, soon assembling into a vaguely humanoid form. It picks up a weapon and gestures at you to challenge it!)

cardBonuses.2: You gain 5% more resources from resource nodes in realms.
cardBonuses.4: You gain 5% more resources from resource nodes in realms.
cardBonuses.7: You gain 5% more resources from resource nodes in realms.

master.dialog: Phase Warriors are from another dimension - one that exists far into the future. Think your medieval creatures can stand up to my army of Phase Warriors? We'll soon find out!
master.name: Ewyn

name: Phase Warrior

bossDialog: Stop laughing at my outfit. STOP IT! RRGH! I'LL KILL YOU!
These claws ain't for show, buddy. Let me give you a demonstration!
You got some pretty poor ideas in that head of yours if you're challenging me. Maybe I should cut it off!

cardBonuses.3: Enemies take 15% more damage from {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_BLEED}.
cardBonuses.6: Enemies have a 10% chance to take double damage from {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_BLEED}.

master.dialog: Pilwizes are crazy little guys who use their scythes to slice their opponents to shreds, leaving any survivors to bleed out. Pretty cruel when you think about it, really, but here we are.\n\nAnyway, let's fight! I promise to give your creatures a clean death.
master.name: Slash

name: Pilwiz

bossDialog: Beat.. you.. and... beat.. you.. AND BEAT YOU AND BEAT YOU AND BEAT YOU! Until.. there's... NOTHING LEFT!!!
Rip.. your.. fingers.. RIGHT OFF! Eat.. them.. UP!!! GRRRR!!!!
Tear.. out.. YOUR HEART! THROW IT.. on.. THE GROUND! Stomp.. on.. it.. OVER AND OVER AND OVER!!

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures have 5% more {STAT_speed}.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures have 5% more {STAT_speed}.
cardBonuses.7: Your creatures have 5% more {STAT_speed}.

master.dialog: Ghouls love to chew on feet. It's certainly a strange fetish, but it does have its uses in battle, believe it or not. Take off your shoes and let's fight!
master.name: Glokta

name: Ghoul

bossDialog: (A huge amount of bugs climb out of holes in the walls and floor and cluster together on one spot, forming the shape of a single much larger bug. They make a horrible noise and attack!)
(Frowning as you see a rather disgusting corpse near the treasure, you barely keep your lunch down as a huge Mite messily bursts out of it, clearly hungry for more!)
(You hear loud scuttling, and soon see one of the largest bugs you've ever seen hungrily running towards you!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures gain 10% more {STAT_speed} from stat-boosting effects.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures gain 10% more {STAT_speed} from stat-boosting effects.
cardBonuses.7: Your creatures gain 10% more {STAT_speed} from stat-boosting effects.

master.dialog: Did you know that Mites are notorious for burrowing into other creatures' ears while they're sleeping? Yeah. They even lay eggs in their brains. Pretty cool, right? Anyway, let's duel!
master.name: Aliphar

name: Mite

bossDialog: (As the Doomguard approaches, weapons raised, it emits a pained and exhausted groan. You darkly wonder if you're doing it a favor by killing it.)
(Despite having been perfectly still the whole time, the Doomguard moves to block your approach to the treasure hoard. You'll have to fight for it!)
(The Doomguard bangs on its shield several times as soon as it catches sight of you, summoning its comrades to attack alongside it.)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures with {CONDNAME_BUFF_TAUNT} take 15% less damage.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures with {CONDNAME_BUFF_TAUNT} have 15% more {STAT_speed}.
cardBonuses.7: Your creatures with {CONDNAME_BUFF_TAUNT} have a 15% chance for effects that occur after they {ACTION_provoke} to occur an additional time.

master.dialog: Doomguards are protective creatures who greatly reduce the damage their allies take. Let's see if you can pierce through my defenses!
master.name: Thesauram

name: Doomguard

bossDialog: (Someone has set a Gargoyle to guard their treasure. It beats its wings, shaking off a considerable layer of dust as it moves to attack!)
(What you thought was a statue comes to life as you approach! Looks like the Gargoyle doesn't want you touching the treasure.)
(You hear a loud, stony thud as a Gargoyle drops from the ceiling in front of you, ready to protect the treasure hoard.)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures take 15% less damage from {CLASS_Chaos} spells.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures take 15% less damage from {CLASS_Chaos} spells.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures take 15% less damage from {CLASS_Chaos} spells.

master.dialog: Gargoyles are great at casting spells - especially Chaos spells! Let me show you how they work!
master.name: Goliath

name: Gargoyle

bossDialog: (Snapping its immense jaws in a threat display, the Carnage makes its hostile intentions clear. You're going to have to fight to escape!)
(The Carnage screams, raw hatred audible on its ragged voice, before lunging towards you!)
(You notice a pile of mangled bodies nearby - presumably the last adventurers to come upon this treasure hoard. Unfortunately, you also notice the Carnage that slew them charging right at you!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures deal 10% more damage to {CLASS_Death} creatures.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures deal 10% more damage to {CLASS_Death} creatures.
cardBonuses.7: Your creatures deal 10% more damage to {CLASS_Death} creatures.

master.dialog: Carnages are downright evil creatures. I can't say too many good things about them aside from the fact that they're good at fighting. One moment, you'll be chatting it up with one of your creatures, and the next thing you know, a Carnage is devouring them. Let's have a quick duel - I promise not to let my Carnages eat your creatures!
master.name: Carnagor

name: Carnage

bossDialog: Come closer, traveler... Come closer... and DIE!
This is my domain. Your precious gods can't save you now.
Your screaming death shall be music to my ears!

cardBonuses.3: Your creatures' Spell Gems have 1 additional {STAT_charge}.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures' Spell Gems have 1 additional {STAT_charge}.
cardBonuses.9: Your creatures' Spell Gems have 1 additional {STAT_charge}.

master.dialog: Banshees have access to empowered versions of different Spell Gems. If you don't manage to seal their gems early on in battle, you'll be sorry!\n\nWith that said, it's time to du-du-du-du-du-duel!
master.name: Shai

name: Banshee

bossDialog: (Almost as fast as you can blink, a large Pit Worm bursts from the ground in the middle of the treasure hoard! Looks like you'll have to deal with it first!)
(As you approach the treasure hoard, a Pit Worm leaps out of a tunnel in the wall and hisses, quickly followed by several other creatures!)
(Hearing the sound of rubble from above, you instinctively leap back as a boulder crashes to the ground where you were standing! Angered, the Pit Worm that dislodged it drops down to attack!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures gain 10% more {STAT_defense} from stat-boosting effects.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures gain 10% more {STAT_defense} from stat-boosting effects.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures gain 10% more {STAT_defense} from stat-boosting effects.

master.dialog: Pit Worms are massive creatures that possess an unbelievable amount of strength. They use their giant bodies to smash their opponents into jelly before eating their corpses whole. Think you can stand up to the might of my Pit Worm army? We shall soon find out!
master.name: Zinud

name: Pit Worm

bossDialog: (You hear light, airy laughter as a mask levitates from the treasure, soon manifesting a smoky body and summoning its allies to attack you!)
Do you desire this treasure, human? Then prove you are worthy of it!
I have no real use for this treasure, but I'm terribly bored. Care to spar for it?

cardBonuses.3: Your creatures' healing effects are 10% more potent.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures receive 10% more healing.
cardBonuses.10: Your creatures' healing effects have a 25% chance to ignore {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_BLIGHT}.

master.dialog: Spirits are cheerful little fellas that take great joy in watching other creatures prosper. For that reason, they typically prefer to heal and empower their allies rather than attack their enemies directly. Let me show you how it's done!
master.name: Muse

name: Spirit

bossDialog: (A Pit Wraith appears before you, and you get the nagging feeling in the back of your mind that you know it; unfortunately, as it is currently trying to kill you, you have to act!)
(As the Pit Wraith that has apparently claimed this treasure hoard appears to defend it, you're struck by a strange sense of deja vu. You quickly shake it off and begin the assault.)
(You suddenly realize you don't actually remember how you got here. You see a Pit Wraith in front of you and immediately realize what's going on, and order your creatures to attack!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures gain 5% more experience points from battles.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures gain 5% more experience points from battles.
cardBonuses.7: Your creatures gain 5% more experience points from battles.

master.dialog: Pit Wraiths are the ultimate disablers. If you're ever looking to overcome a problematic encounter, consider adding a Pit Wraith to your party and they'll take care of it for you. If you have a moment to spare, I'd love to show off my Pit Wraiths to you!
master.name: Brithyr

name: Pit Wraith

bossDialog: (Issuing an obnoxiously loud bellow and filling the room with the smell of its stale breath, the Fiend charges forward the second it sees you!)
(The Fiend whips around to look at you, various objects falling out of its mouth. You have your monsters attack, hoping the beast hasn't eaten too much of the treasure...)
(You seem to have caught the Fiend in the middle of trying to swallow an entire treasure chest in one bite. You duck as it spits it at you at high velocity. Get ready for a fight!)

cardBonuses.2: Increases the amount of damage your creatures deal while they're {CONDNAME_BUFF_BERSERK} by 15%.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures with {CONDNAME_BUFF_BERSERK} have a 10% chance to attack an additional time.
cardBonuses.7: Your creatures with {CONDNAME_BUFF_BERSERK} have a 15% greater chance to deal critical damage.

master.dialog: Fiends have some serious anger issues, and that's just fine with me. They're almost always looking for someone or something to take out their aggression on, making them ideal combatants. My Fiends will rip your creatures to shreds. Let's fight!
master.name: Arner

name: Fiend

bossDialog: My weapons are honed well for dealing with the likes of you, intruder.
What the hell is your problem? Can't you humans leave our kind in peace?
You touch my treasure, you die. You wouldn't even know what to do with it anyway.

cardBonuses.3: Your Artifacts' Stat Slots are 5% more powerful.
cardBonuses.6: Your Artifacts' Trick Slots have a 10% greater chance to activate.
cardBonuses.10: Your Artifacts' Spell Slots have a 10% greater chance to activate.

master.dialog: With the help of their Artifacts, Smiths are great at bolstering their allies' strength. Care for a duel? I've been standing in one place for several days now, waiting for someone like you to come along and put me out of my misery.
master.name: Olof

name: Smith

bossDialog: (Someone has leashed the Hound near the treasure chests, a fairly traditional way to protect them. It starts barking loudly before you can stop it, summoning the owners!)
(The Hound growls loudly and issues a loud howl, waking up a group of sleeping and now very angry creatures nearby. Why can't things just be easy for once?)
(Wasting no time in summoning its friends, the Hound dives right at you and your creatures with a ravenous look in its eyes!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures take 15% less damage from {CLASS_Death} spells.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures take 15% less damage from {CLASS_Death} spells.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures take 15% less damage from {CLASS_Death} spells.

master.dialog: Hounds prefer to travel in packs, and call upon their direwolf allies to aid them in battle. You'd be amazed at how quickly a few Hounds can amass an entire army of wolves to tear their foes apart. Care to see my Hounds in action?
master.name: Bourbon

name: Hound

bossDialog: I shall take everything you have built, everything you have, everything you cherish... and more.
You think you deserve these riches? What you deserve is a slow, painful death.
You will pay the price for disrespecting your betters. You shall die one thousand slow, agonizing deaths at my hands.

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures take 15% less damage from {CLASS_Life} spells.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures take 15% less damage from {CLASS_Life} spells.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures take 15% less damage from {CLASS_Life} spells.

master.dialog: Demigods are manipulative creatures that mold their friends and foes to suit their needs. Why don't we have a quick duel so I can show you how they work?
master.name: Raylen

name: Demigod

bossDialog: (Sitting next to the treasure pile, the robed figure plays a few notes on a flute - soon, a vicious beast larger than the figure appears, growling at you menacingly!)
(The Hunter immediately lobs a glaive at you the second it catches sight of you. Calling its steed and allies, it mounts up and recalls its glaive before assuming a combat stance!)
(The rider seems to be pointing at you. Confused for a moment, one of your creatures suddenly shoves you out of the way of a volley of arrows from the dark! Time for a fight!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures gain 10% more {STAT_attack} from stat-boosting effects.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures gain 10% more {STAT_attack} from stat-boosting effects.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures gain 10% more {STAT_attack} from stat-boosting effects.

master.dialog: Hunters tend to travel with their own kind, capitalizing on their ability to strike multiple foes at once by enchanting each other's glaives. While Hunters tend to be quite weak from a defensive perspective, they'll make quick work of your creatures. Let's duel!
master.name: Joe

name: Hunter

bossDialog: Challenge one, and you challenge us all. Have at you!
For the glory of Gonfurian! For the horde! CHARGE!!!
Look brothers, a worthy opponent! To arms!

cardBonuses.3: Your creatures have a 5% chance to {ACTION_attack} an additional time.
cardBonuses.7: Your creatures have a 5% chance to {ACTION_cast} spells an additional time.
cardBonuses.11: Doubles the chance for these effects to occur.

master.dialog: Diabolic Horde are perhaps the most cooperative of any creature in all of Rodia. They encourage and empower one another with only one goal in mind: to achieve victory at all costs. Frankly, I don't think you stand a chance, but we shall see soon enough!
master.name: Woovie

name: Diabolic Horde

bossDialog: Fool. You never heard the old saying? Never bring your pets to a gun fight.
Shame I didn't see you come in sooner. I could've used the target practice.
You want this treasure? You gotta pry it outta my cold, dead hands.\n\n...well, you know what I mean.

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures deal 5% more damage with attacks.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures deal 5% more damage with attacks.
cardBonuses.7: Your creatures deal 5% more damage with attacks.

master.dialog: Skeletons may be frail, but they make up for their lack of fortitude with an insane amount of firepower. I mean, there's no way the average living organism can survive a barrage of gunshots, right? In fact, don't you find it weird that, in a world that has guns, only Skeletons bother to use them? Anyway, let's duel!
master.name: Axl

name: Skeleton

bossDialog: (Hymns and songs you do not recognize ring around the room, but abruptly stop as you approach the treasure hoard. The Priest guarding it summons its allies to attack you!)
(Struck by an unusual calm, you quickly realize the Priest is weaving magic to simply lull you into surrendering without a fight. Not today.)
(The Priest raises its staff into the air and begins to emit an increasingly bright light, attempting to conceal itself. You counter the spell and order your creatures to attack!)

cardBonuses.3: Your creatures have 10% more {STAT_speed} while they're {ACTION_defending}.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures have 10% more {STAT_speed} while they're {ACTION_defending}.
cardBonuses.9: Your creatures have 10% more {STAT_speed} while they're {ACTION_defending}.

master.dialog: I believe that every group should have at least a few Priests, as they're one of the most well-rounded creatures in all of Rodia. They have the unique ability to empower your other creatures at breakneck speeds, causing them to snowball until they become unstoppable. Let me show you what I mean!
master.name: Father Daddson

name: Priest

bossDialog: (Smashing its way out of the ground, the Forsaken smiles wickedly at you as other creatures appear to aid it in battle!)
(The Forsaken starts crawling along the floor backwards at you, its head twisted all the way around to stare at you. You quickly have your creatures intercept!)
Grrrgghhh... join uuuussss...

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures have 1 more base {STAT_defense}.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures have 1 more base {STAT_defense}.
cardBonuses.7: Your creatures have 1 more base {STAT_defense}.

master.dialog: Forsaken are unimaginably powerful creatures, but such strength comes at a cost. They're cursed, you see, and this curse causes their bodies to decompose in the midst of battle. A bit unfortunate, but the tradeoff is well worth it. Let me show you how it's done!
master.name: Savine

name: Forsaken

bossDialog: Hrngh. Got work to do. Don't get in way.
This room for Ims. You not Im. Get out.
You not hurt the Imlings. I make sure of that.

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures have 10% more {STAT_defense} while they're {ACTION_provoking}.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures have 10% more {STAT_defense} while they're {ACTION_provoking}.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures have 10% more {STAT_defense} while they're {ACTION_provoking}.

master.dialog: Imlers are huge, lumbering creatures that pack a serious punch. Unfortunately, though, they're not too smart. But that's what they have their cunning Imling partners for! Imlers and Imlings have a symbiotic relationship with each other, capitalizing on each other's strengths and shoring up their weaknesses. Let me show you!
master.name: Rathik

name: Imler

bossDialog: AAAAAH! It's a madge! ..maych? maige? ...wizard. IT'S A WIZARD! ALLIES, HELP ME!
Hey, you wanna see something awesome? DON'T LOOK IN A MIRROR, THEN!\n\n(You decide to attack while the Imling is laughing uproariously. Totally not out of wounded pride or anything, mind you.)
Oh cripes, what's THAT?!\n(The Imling points behind you. You shake your head in disbelief, until you hear the footsteps of the Imling's allies behind you...)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures have 10% more {STAT_defense} while they're {ACTION_defending}.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures have 10% more {STAT_defense} while they're {ACTION_defending}.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures have 10% more {STAT_defense} while they're {ACTION_defending}.

master.dialog: Imlings are extremely intelligent creatures that are known for their devious battle tactics. However, they're quite frail and can't take too many hits before they fall, so they rely on their massive Imler partners for protection. Let me show you how it's done!
master.name: Tad

name: Imling

bossDialog: Ah, good! Someone to beat up! I've been bored out of my mind all day!
Another weakling! I'm gonna smash you into paste!
Stepping into MY territory? You've gone and !@#$ed up now!

cardBonuses.3: Your creatures have 5% more Maximum {STAT_health}.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures have 5% more Maximum {STAT_health}.

master.dialog: Giants are hearty creatures that can take a serious beating without even batting an eye. Your creatures will probably exhaust themselves long before they can so much as scratch my Giants! Let's do this!
master.name: Gorst

name: Giant

bossDialog: (Screeching loudly, the Wolpertinger hurls itself at you in a violent, frothing rage! It's astounding these things don't die of pure rage. Nothing should be THAT angry.)
(The Wolpertinger gets so mad at the sight of you it starts thrashing around and drooling all over itself. What an utter mess of a creature. You'll have to deal with it if you want the treasure!)
(You spot a cute bunny! Except then you spot the antlers, wings, and enraged twitching glare, and soon think twice about petting it. You order your creatures to "pet" it instead.)

cardBonuses.3: Your creatures have a 5% chance to {ACTION_attack} an additional time.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures have a 5% chance to {ACTION_cast} spells an additional time.
cardBonuses.9: Doubles the chance for these effects to occur.

master.dialog: Wolpertingers have access to powerful Scourge magic that will wipe your creatures off the face of this planet. Prepare yourself!
master.name: Nimet

name: Wolpertinger

cardBonuses.2: Increases the chance for Dumplings to spawn by 50%.
cardBonuses.5: Increases the chance for Dumplings to spawn by 50%.
cardBonuses.8: Increases the chance for Dumplings to spawn by 50%.

master.dialog: Dumplings are very good at making new friends. Ever since I started traveling with a few Dumplings in my party, I've come across all kinds of rare and interesting creatures. You should try it sometime!\n\nBut first, you owe me a duel!
master.name: Gelotte

bossDialog: (A loud bellow and the thunder of hooves herald the charge of a very angry Apis; one who seems to have brought its friends to attack you!)
(The Apis lowers its head and scrapes its hooves on the ground as you approach, as an obvious warning. You'll have to defeat it to get the treasure.)
(Your magical senses feel a surge of energy - the only warning you get before one of your creatures pushes you out of the path of a charging Apis!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures with {CONDNAME_BUFF_PROTECT} take 10% less damage.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures with {CONDNAME_BUFF_PROTECT} take 10% less damage.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures with {CONDNAME_BUFF_PROTECT} have a 5% chance to avoid damage from attacks and spells.

master.dialog: Apises are formidable in both offense and defense, making them some of the toughest creatures you'll find. Let's have a quick duel so you can experience what I'm talking about first-hand!
master.name: Hashir

name: Apis

bossDialog: (A ghostly entity pirouettes through the air from behind the treasure and lands, blocking your path with wild but graceful twirls and flourishes. Looks like a fight!)
(Atop the pile of treasure, the flaming form of a Rift Dancer twirls and dances beautifully. Distracted by the display, you almost fail to notice its allies sneaking up on you!)
(The Rift Dancer begins a graceful and even beautiful dance... that apparently ends with it kicking you right in the head. Ouch. Your creatures immediately retaliate!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures with {CONDNAME_BUFF_WARD} gain 20% more stats.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures with {CONDNAME_BUFF_WARD} have a 25% chance to resist debuffs.
cardBonuses.7: Your creatures with {CONDNAME_BUFF_WARD} have 30% more {STAT_defense}.

master.dialog: Rift Dancers are some of the most graceful creatures in existence. Their unique dances empower their allies, granting them powerful boons that can turn the tide of battle. Let's see if you can stand up against my Rift Dancer army!
master.name: Zarveo

name: Rift Dancer

bossDialog: (Knowing how dangerously diseased these creatures are, you make sure to stay well back as you give your creatures the order to attack.)
(The Leper comes barreling at you with surprising speed considering its awkward bulk and gait. Your creatures circle around you, ready to protect your life!)
(You almost gag as you approach the treasure hoard, the smell of rancid pus hanging thick in the air. You hope this will be a quick fight so you can get out of here.)

cardBonuses.2: Enemies deal 15% less damage from their {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_WEAK} debuffs.
cardBonuses.5: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_WEAK} have a 50% lower chance to deal critical damage.
cardBonuses.8: Enemies' {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_WEAK} debuffs last forever.

master.dialog: Lepers are cute little guys who just need a hug. The problem is, establishing physical contact with them tends to lead to all sorts of terrible diseases. Want to see? No? Well, too bad!
master.name: Big Ed

name: Leper

bossDialog: (Hefting its weapon and approaching slowly with its guard raised, the Crusader signals its intent to protect the treasure by force!)
(Suddenly charging in out of nowhere, the Crusader almost takes your head off with its weapon, but you thankfully duck its swing in time! Your creatures move to protect you!)
(The Crusader guarding the treasure, despite staying as still as a stone the whole time you were in the room, suddenly slams its weapon into the ground as you approach!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures' {CONDNAME_BUFF_SHELL} buffs have a 10% chance to persist after taking damage.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures with {CONDNAME_BUFF_SHELL} have a 5% chance to avoid damage.
cardBonuses.8: Doubles the chance for these effects to occur.

master.dialog: Crusaders are defensive melee attackers that can pack a serious punch while also taking a beating themselves. Here, let me show you just how tough they are!
master.name: Orlik

name: Crusader

bossDialog: (A loud shriek issues from above as a Griffon descends, whirling its claws in a threatening flourish. You're not taking its treasure without a fight.)
(Hoping to sneak up to the treasure without waking up the Griffon sleeping on it, you accidentally stub your toe on a loose rock and cuss loudly. It wakes up and dives at you immediately!)
(The Griffon stands proudly atop the treasure, glaring at you. It's as if it's daring you to challenge it - you are, of course, happy to oblige.)

cardBonuses.2: You gain 15% more resources from battles.
cardBonuses.5: You gain 10 more resources from battles.
cardBonuses.8: You have a 15% chance to gain double resources from battles.

master.dialog: Griffons are fast-moving creatures that work together to bombard their foes from the skies. Do you really think your creatures stand a chance against my team of Griffons? We'll soon find out!
master.name: Gryffindor

name: Griffon

bossDialog: (A burst of divine fire ignites above the treasure, as a golden ring manifests within it. A huge eye gazes at you as the creature moves to attack!)
(Spinning its ring faster and faster, the Ophan begins to charge some kind of spell as you approach. You order your creatures to put a stop to it.)
(The Ophan, guarding the treasure hoard, begins to loudly sing what sounds like battle hymns as it spots you. Its allies, rallied by the song, move in to attack you and your creatures!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures' {CLASS_Life} spells deal 10% more damage.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures' damaging {CLASS_Life} spells ignore 10% of their enemies' {STAT_defense}.
cardBonuses.7: Your creatures' {CLASS_Life} spells have 10% additional {STAT_charges}.

master.dialog: Ophans are proficient Life-based spellcasters that specialize in restorative magic. They look really damn cool, too.\n\nOrphans, you say? No, not orphans - Ophans! I will punish you for your stupidity!
master.name: Izor

name: Ophan

bossDialog: (As you prepare to face the Sin guarding the treasure in battle, you make a mental note to check for any curses on the treasure afterwards. Can't be too careful around Sins.)
(This Sin, true to its nature, has greedily laid claim to the treasure hoard. With a fleeting thought of irony at your own potential greed, you order your creatures to attack.)
(You immediately recognize the insidious creature before you from tales your teachers would tell you of Rodia's most dangerous beasts. You steel yourself for battle and advance.)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures have 1 more base {STAT_intelligence}.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures have 1 more base {STAT_intelligence}.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures have 1 more base {STAT_intelligence}.

master.dialog: Much like their Sanctus counterparts, Sins all bring something different to the battlefield. Frankly, I'm not particularly fond of these creatures, but who would pass up the opportunity to be referred to as the Master of Sins?\n\nAnyway, let's fight!
master.name: Damien

name: Sin

bossDialog: (Noting the irony that a creature of supposed virtue is covetously protecting a pile of treasure, you order your creatures to take out the Sanctus with extreme prejudice.)
(The Sanctus begins to approach you silently, raising the items clutched in its claws. Knowing the danger well, you have your creatures immediately attack it without hesitation.)
(You curse your luck internally as you spot the Sanctus guarding the treasure. Taking no chances, you immediately order your creatures to destroy the awful creature.)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures' {CONDNAME_BUFF_BARRIER} buffs absorb 15% more damage.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures' {CONDNAME_BUFF_BARRIER} buffs absorb 15% more damage.
cardBonuses.8: After your creatures' {CONDNAME_BUFF_BARRIER} buffs are destroyed, they have a 5% chance to gain {CONDNAME_BUFF_SHELL}.

master.dialog: Sanctuses are a mixed bag, really. Each one brings something completely unique to battle, but one thing everyone can agree on is that they're some of the most useful creatures Rodia has to offer. But don't take my word for it - I'll let you judge them yourself!
master.name: Edo

name: Sanctus

bossDialog: Good thing no-one will ever find your body; that way they don't have to think about how painful your death is about to be!
I've spent my whole life fighting; I've earned this treasure. I'm not giving it up to a spoiled brat like you!
NGAAAAAAH!!! I thought this hideout was well-hidden! I'm gonna KILL you!

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures take 2% less damage for each debuff they have.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures deal 2% more damage for each debuff they have.
cardBonuses.8: These bonuses apply to buffs as well.

master.dialog: Revenants are noble creatures who willingly sacrifice their own well-being for the greater good of their comrades. Do you really think you can take down a team as cooperative as mine?
master.name: Brashen

name: Revenant

bossDialog: I never can tell you apes apart. All of your foolish bravado is at odds with your simpering weakness.
Miserable human slave. Die screaming and forgotten, like your worthless ancestors!
To earn this treasure, you must answer one hundred riddles. My first riddl-\n\n(Nope. Attack!)

cardBonuses.2: Enemies have 5% less {STAT_attack}.
cardBonuses.4: Enemies gain 25% less {STAT_attack}.
cardBonuses.7: Enemies have 50% less benefit from their Artifacts' Stat Slots that boost their {STAT_attack}.

master.dialog: Sphinxes are perhaps the most adaptive creatures Rodia has to offer. They're able to change their class identity in the midst of battle to suit their needs. If your team isn't equally flexible, you're going to have a hard time against me. Let's duel!
master.name: Leonault

name: Sphinx

bossDialog: Begone, trespasser. I will not allow you to defile this tribute.
I was ordered to protect these riches with my life. I will not abandon my duty. Prepare yourself.
This is consecrated ground. You are not permitted here. I will make this swift and painless.

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures take 5% less damage from attacks.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures take 5% less damage from attacks.
cardBonuses.7: Your creatures take 5% less damage from attacks.

master.dialog: Seraphs wield the blessings of the kingdoms of Rodia. Do you think you stand a chance against such power? We will soon find out.
master.name: Irinth

name: Seraph

bossDialog: Do you have any idea how long I've been guarding these useless trinkets for? I'm bored out of my mind! FIGHT ME!
Interloper! Blessed Surathli, guide the edge of my weapon! Aid me in slaying this foe!
On my honor, you will not touch so much as a gram of this treasure.

cardBonuses.2: Enemies have a 10% lower chance to deal critical damage.
cardBonuses.5: Enemies deal 30% less critical damage.
cardBonuses.8: Enemies have a 75% maximum chance to deal critical damage.

master.dialog: Valkyries are well-rounded creatures that live to keep their allies safe from harm. Let's see if you can break down my defenses in a duel!
master.name: Althea

name: Valkyrie

bossDialog: (Issuing three simultaneous war cries at once in a deafening tritone, the Apocalypse surges forward to meet you in battle!)
(The Apocalypse weaves its heads around, blocking your approach to the treasure hoard. It seems to have claimed the treasure for its own!)
(The huge beast rises up, its bulk and three heads towering over you. You take a moment to admire its sheer power before ordering your creatures to attack!)

cardBonuses.2: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_SCORN} deal 10% less damage.
cardBonuses.4: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_SCORN} take 10% more damage.
cardBonuses.7: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_SCORN} have a 5% chance for their spells to fizzle.

master.dialog: Apocalypses grow exponentially more powerful as the battle drags on. If you want to defeat me, you'll have to do it fast!
master.name: Gregnan

name: Apocalypse

bossDialog: (A small baby floats in the air in the midst of the treasure hoard. Its eyes begin to glow, and it projects a frightful apparition to battle you with, calling allies to its aid!)
(The sounds of wailing and sobbing fill the chamber. As you approach the Spectre cautiously, it whips around with a terrifying shriek and lunges towards you!)
(You see a small, crying child, begging for your aid. Not fooled, you dispel the illusion to reveal a deadly Spectre; one that is now very angry with you!)

cardBonuses.2: Enemies have 5% less {STAT_defense}.
cardBonuses.5: Enemies gain 25% less {STAT_defense}.
cardBonuses.8: Enemies have 50% less benefit from their Artifacts' Stat Slots that boost their {STAT_defense}.

master.dialog: Spectres excel at crippling their opponents to make for an easy kill. Their kids are really great, too. Well, I mean, those babies probably aren't really their own kids... but, you know. Anyway, let's duel!
master.name: Remane

name: Spectre

bossDialog: (The Grimoire immediately starts casting a curse as soon as you approach it. Not wanting to be any more cursed than usual, you order your creatures to put a stop to it.)
There are over 5,000 ways to utterly humiliate you contained within my pages. Are you SURE you want to fight me?
You've learned how to use magic? Cute. I'm the one people learn to use magic FROM. Let me show you how it's done.

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures' {CONDNAME_BUFF_ARCANE} buffs have a 5% chance to grant the Spell Gem an extra {STAT_charge} when it activates.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures' {CONDNAME_BUFF_ARCANE} buffs have a 10% chance to not be removed after they cast a spell.
cardBonuses.8: Doubles the chance for these effects to occur.

master.dialog: Grimoires are great for powering up certain Spell Gems to make them even stronger yet. Care to see what I mean? Let's duel!
master.name: Lake

name: Grimoire

bossDialog: (One of the Cerberus's heads starts barking, and another one seems to start barking back at the other head. You take advantage of its confusion to attack!)
(The Cerberus growls while chewing on a particularly large bone. It charges at you, no doubt thinking you want to steal its dinner!)
(The chained beast rises as you approach, howling loudly from all three heads. The noise attracts the owners of the treasure hoard!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures' {CLASS_Chaos} spells deal 10% more damage.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures' damaging {CLASS_Chaos} spells ignore 10% of their enemies' {STAT_defense}.
cardBonuses.7: Your creatures' {CLASS_Chaos} spells have 10% additional {STAT_charges}.

master.dialog: Cerberuses... Cerberi? Hmmm.\n\nAnyway, my creatures may not be able to cast spells through traditional means, but that doesn't mean they can't make use of their Spell Gems for other purposes. Allow me to demonstrate!
master.name: Yash

name: Cerberus

bossDialog: How bold of you to seek me out. I welcome your challenge. Let us fight...
My blade, your wit. Which shall be found to be sharper?
You've got some nerve challenging the likes of I.

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures with {CONDNAME_BUFF_SAVAGE} have a 10% greater chance to deal critical damage.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures with {CONDNAME_BUFF_SAVAGE} deal 30% more critical damage.
cardBonuses.7: Your creatures' {CONDNAME_BUFF_SAVAGE} buff lasts forever.

master.dialog: Asuras are formidable melee attackers that can dish out some massive critical damage. Care for a duel? I won't go easy on you!
master.name: Apok

name: Asura

bossDialog: (A frigid breeze blows by and encases the treasure in solid ice. You soon hear a low growl as a huge Yeti emerges from the shadows, furious at your intrusion!)
(A large chunk of ice sits among the treasure hoard. Soon it begins to crack and splinter, before shattering outright as the Yeti within bursts free and attacks!)
(The Yeti looks up at you hungrily, dropping the piece of meat it had been eating when you entered the room and advancing upon you with a greedy look in its eyes!)

cardBonuses.2: {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_FROZEN} enemies have a 5% lower base chance to thaw.
cardBonuses.4: Decreases {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_FROZEN} enemies' chance to thaw each turn by 10%.
cardBonuses.7: Enemies' {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_FROZEN} debuffs have a 50% chance to not gain an increased chance to thaw at the end of their turns.

master.dialog: My Yetis will freeze your creatures in their tracks. I'll finish you off before your creatures get a chance to move! Let's fight!
master.name: Bjorn

name: Yeti

bossDialog: (Reacting to the ambient, magical energy around you, the Watcher charges forward with an angry look in its eye!)
(You are very well aware of the threat this creature poses from the history classes you had when growing up. Staying on guard, you order your creatures to attack!)
(You feel like the creature before you is gazing right into your soul. Your creatures barely deflect it in time as it suddenly lunches forward, attempting to bite you!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures take 15% less damage from attacks from {CLASS_Sorcery} creatures.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures take 15% less damage from attacks from {CLASS_Sorcery} creatures.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures take 15% less damage from attacks from {CLASS_Sorcery} creatures.

master.dialog: Watchers are intelligent creatures that excel at capitalizing on their opponents' weaknesses. On top of that, they look really cool. Sorry, but I just don't see a world where you can defeat me.
master.name: Seuzan

name: Watcher

bossDialog: (Pacing back and forth, the Manticore whips its stinger tail around and shakes its mane in an attempt at intimidation. Unfazed, you begin the assault.)
(The Manticore was already alert when you entered, having smelled a human. You wonder what kind of evil could create such a beast as you order your creatures to kill it.)
(Your blood runs cold as the Manticore meets your gaze and bares its fangs. It's a good thing your creatures are here to protect you.)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures take 15% less damage from attacks from {CLASS_Chaos} creatures.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures take 15% less damage from attacks from {CLASS_Chaos} creatures.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures take 15% less damage from attacks from {CLASS_Chaos} creatures.

master.dialog: Manticores excel at turning a good defense into a brilliant offense. They're a sturdy race that can take some hits while also packing a serious punch, making them all-around great combatants. Let me show you in a duel!
master.name: Reyson

name: Manticore

bossDialog: Ahh, another sssstatue for my collection. Do get into a nice pose, would you?
Come and see, sisterssss! Another blundering fool to devour!
We haven't forgotten how your kind has treated ussss. We won't submit to your cruelty ever again.

cardBonuses.2: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_STONE} take 10% more damage from attacks and spells.
cardBonuses.4: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_STONE} take 10% more damage from non-attack and non-spell damage.
cardBonuses.7: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_STONE} receive 25% less stat gains.

master.dialog: Gorgons turn their enemies to stone. Yep, it's that simple. Good luck beating that!\n\nLet's fight!
master.name: Zola

name: Gorgon

bossDialog: Aren't you tired of all this fighting yet? Believe me; you will be one day. And unlike you, I don't get to stop.
I've fought worse than you. Been killed by worse than you, too. Either way, I'll have forgotten you within the hour.
To you, this is a battle for your life. To me, it's just another day of eternity.

cardBonuses.3: You gain 30% more {RES_GRANITE} from battles.
cardBonuses.6: Increases the base amount of {RES_GRANITE} gained from battles by 15.
cardBonuses.9: You have a 15% chance to gain double {RES_GRANITE} from battles.

master.dialog: Simply put, Wights refuse to die. I can assure you that you won't be winning a battle against my immortal army of the dead any time soon. Still not convinced? Then let's fight!
master.name: Jawack

name: Wight

bossDialog: (As you approach the treasure hoard, you catch motion in the corner of your eye and barely evade a well-concealed Shade's surprise attack! Your creatures immediately respond to protect you!)
(Creepy whispers echo around the room as the smoky form of a Shade coalesces in front of you. Looks like you're not getting any easy treasure today.)
Surrender, human, and I will make your death swift and painless...\n\n(Yeah, that's not happening.)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures take 15% less damage while they're {CONDNAME_BUFF_INVISIBLE}.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures have a 10% chance to not lose their {CONDNAME_BUFF_INVISIBLE} buff after they {ACTION_attack} or {ACTION_cast} spells.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures take 15% less damage while they're {CONDNAME_BUFF_INVISIBLE}.

master.dialog: How can you kill that which you cannot see? My Shades will decimate your creatures before they even know what hit 'em!
master.name: Mort

name: Shade

bossDialog: (The Masochist cracks an unnerving grin before shoving one of their katars right through their own hand, licking the blood off the blade. You decide to finish this before it gets any more awkward.)
Don't be afraid. I have such sights to show you.
Hit me as hard as you can. I love it!

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures take 3% less damage.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures take 3% less damage.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures take 3% less damage.

master.dialog: Masochists realize that, much like how it takes money to make money, it also takes pain to make pain. Sure, they spend the first several moments of battle taking a beating, but they're great at turning things around. Let me show you!
master.name: Sceledrus

name: Masochist

bossDialog: (The ground itself shakes beneath your feet - just as you start to think it's an earthquake, a strange creature made of the ground itself pulls itself out of the floor and attacks!)
(The Tremor begins stomping its feet rhythmically and screaming at ear-ruining volume. You resolve to quickly kill it before you end up going deaf!)
(You notice the room looks rather strangely arranged - right as you knock over a pile of stones. A nearby Tremor takes incredible offense to your accidental vandalism, and comes charging at you!)

cardBonuses.2: Enemies have 5% less {STAT_intelligence}.
cardBonuses.4: Enemies gain 25% less {STAT_intelligence}.
cardBonuses.7: Enemies have 50% less benefit from their Artifacts' Stat Slots that boost their {STAT_intelligence}.

master.dialog: If you're ever struggling to defeat your enemies, you should consider adding a Tremor or two to your party. These massive creatures are great at interrupting their enemies, preventing them from taking action. Allow me to demonstrate!
master.name: Delice

name: Tremor

bossDialog: (An Arachnalisk descends on a line of silk and quickly skitters at you, claws raised. Your creatures move to intercept it!)
(Chittering, you hear a snapping noise and look up to see an Arachnalisk cutting some webbed creatures free. As they panic and begin to attack you, it joins the fray!)
(Your foot snags on something sticky as you approach the treasure hoard. Noticing webs elsewhere in the room, you barely have time to cut yourself free before their weaver pounces!)

cardBonuses.2: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_SNARED} have a 10% lower chance to break free.
cardBonuses.5: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_SNARED} deal 20% less damage.
cardBonuses.8: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_SNARED} have a 10% lower chance to break free.

master.dialog: Arachnalisks prefer to ensnare their opponents before poisoning them, watching as their foes suffer long and painful deaths.\n\nBut anyway, how are you doing today? Care for a duel?
master.name: Jimeous

name: Arachnalisk

bossDialog: Commiserations, mendicant; I have deigned to requisition these sorcerous provisions for my own contemplations. Be off with you.
Do you MIND?! You're enturbulating the inverse negative transflux flow of the local coalescent arcanospheric manifold, you utter buffoon!
I object most vehemently to your sudden odiferous habitation of my private environs! Begone lest I lambaste your inadequate sanitation further!

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures deal 5% more damage with spells.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures deal 5% more damage with spells.
cardBonuses.7: Your creatures deal 5% more damage with spells.

master.dialog: Familiars are studious creatures who work together for a common cause - often in an effort to better their own research. Familiars are always looking for new ways to power up their spells. Care to see firsthand what they've learned recently?
master.name: Bayaz

name: Familiar

bossDialog: FOOL... ME SQUASH.....
UGLY.... WEAKLING....
YOU NO TAKE TREASURE....

cardBonuses.2: Enemies have a 5% lower chance to Dodge attacks.
cardBonuses.5: Enemies have a 5% lower chance to Dodge attacks.
cardBonuses.8: Enemies have a 5% lower chance to Dodge attacks.

master.dialog: Gargantuans are as patient as they are powerful. It takes a few moments for them to utilize their full power, but when they finally do... fireworks!\n\nCare for a duel? My Gargantuans are growing restless.
master.name: Drust

name: Gargantuan

bossDialog: (An almost imperceptible ripple on the air near the treasure hoard rouses your suspicions. You cast a vision spell to make out what it is, but it reacts to the use of magical energy and attacks!)

(You recognize a whirling Vortex guarding the treasure. As you approach it begins to intensify, growing larger and whirling ever faster - you'll have to destroy it before it builds up to lethal speed!)
(Your skin tingles as you hear a loud electrical crackling sound - soon enough a Vortex coalesces itself in front of you and your monsters, ready to do battle!)

cardBonuses.3: Your creatures take 15% less damage from {CLASS_Sorcery} spells.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures take 15% less damage from {CLASS_Sorcery} spells.
cardBonuses.9: Your creatures take 15% less damage from {CLASS_Sorcery} spells.

master.dialog: Vortexes... no, Vortices... no... I don't know. Anyway, these creatures are the ultimate disruptors. Just when you think you've got your battle strategy all figured out, my creatures will foil your plans. Perhaps a demonstration is in order - let's fight!
master.name: Breeze

name: Vortex

bossDialog: (A Waspid the size of a cow with a stinger longer than most swords you've seen confronts you. You forgot to prepare any bug spray spells this morning, so you'll have to deal with this the hard way!)
(Spotting a large insect hive in the corner, you resolve to sneak up on the treasure quietly. Unfortunately, you step on something that makes a loud noise and soon attract their attention...)
(You hear buzzing in the air, which soon grows to an unreasonably loud volume. You soon find the source - an immensely large wasp guarding the treasure!)

cardBonuses.2: Enemies have 5% less {STAT_speed}.
cardBonuses.4: Enemies gain 25% less {STAT_speed}.
cardBonuses.7: Enemies have 50% less benefit from their Artifacts' Stat Slots that boost their {STAT_speed}.

master.dialog: There's nothing quite as terrifying as being chased by a swarm of Waspids. You've been warned. This is going to suck for you.
master.name: Auran

name: Waspid

bossDialog: (A Bard sits atop the treasure hoard, and begins to play an incredibly annoying tune with a musical instrument. You order your creatures to take the instrument and do unpleasant things to the Bard with it.)

(As you approach the treasure, a Bard appears! Despite using an unknown language, it issues forth an insult so reprehensible you immediately have your creatures charge forward to beat the !@#$ out of it!)
(You suddenly start hearing the sound of jeering crowds and mocking laughter in your head. You soon catch sight of the Bard responsible and tell your creatures to put an end to it!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures take 5% less damage from attacks.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures take 5% less damage from attacks.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures take 5% less damage from attacks.

master.dialog: Many Bards enable your creatures' attack damage to come from different stats. Others provide a variety of beneficial effects to your creatures. Let's have a duel, and then I'll have one of my Bards treat you to a song afterward!
master.name: Fitz

name: Bard

bossDialog: (The Centaur stomps its hooves rhythmically while loudly chanting. Soon enough, its allies appear to defend the treasure!)
Choose your death: trampled, stabbed, choked, or beaten? Perhaps I will do them all at once!
The clan demands victory! On my life, I will deliver your head on a platter to the Khan!

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures deal 10% more damage to {CLASS_Nature} creatures.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures deal 10% more damage to {CLASS_Nature} creatures.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures deal 10% more damage to {CLASS_Nature} creatures.

master.dialog: Centaurs tend to shy away from spellcasting in favor of strong melee attacks - which is great, since that means I don't ever have to worry about my creatures' Spell Gems running out of Charges! Think you've got what it takes to bring me down?
master.name: Shun

name: Centaur

bossDialog: (Pulling out two vicious looking daggers and clanging them against each other repeatedly, the Elf successfully communicates what it wants to do to you pretty clearly.)
(The Elf invokes what you can only assume from the tone are several elven epithets in your direction, before drawing a rather wicked-looking weapon!)
