I did not give you permission to come bungling into my territory, you unwashed ape. You will pay in blood.

cardBonuses.3: You gain 30% more {RES_CRYSTAL} from battles.
cardBonuses.6: Increases the base amount of {RES_CRYSTAL} gained from battles by 15.
cardBonuses.9: You have a 15% chance to gain double {RES_CRYSTAL} from battles.

master.dialog: Elves are great at foiling their foes' strategies. Right when you think you've got it all figured out, my Elves will come in and ruin your day. Let's fight!
master.name: Jesper

name: Elf

bossDialog: (It tries to mumble something at you, but its mouths have been stitched shut. This poor creature's death can surely only be a release from its torment.)
WE... MUST... GUARD. WE... SORRY.
YOU... NO... TALK... TO ME... OR MY PLUSH... EVER AGAIN...

cardBonuses.2: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_VULNERABLE} take 15% more damage.
cardBonuses.5: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_VULNERABLE} have a 10% lower chance to Dodge.
cardBonuses.8: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_VULNERABLE} gain 35% less healing from all sources.

master.dialog: Abominations excel at exploiting the weak and vulnerable. Let me show you how it's done!
master.name: Gilbert

name: Abomination

bossDialog: (You recoil back as a thrown knife embeds itself in the ground at your feet. The Nix who threw it quickly descends from the ceiling for another attempt upon your life!)
My sisters will grant me glory when I bring your severed head back to the underworld!
We are the true rulers of the world, human filth. Suffer and die!

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures take 15% less damage from attacks from {CLASS_Death} creatures.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures take 15% less damage from attacks from {CLASS_Death} creatures.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures take 15% less damage from attacks from {CLASS_Death} creatures.

master.dialog: Nixes are crafty little devils who excel at devising a strategy ahead of time and executing it with flawless grace in the midst of battle. Let me show you how it's done!
master.name: Ferra

name: Nix

bossDialog: I require these supplies for my works. You bring suffering upon the world by seizing them from me.
There is a great imbalance within you. Let me help you.\n\n(The Plague Doctor pulls out a terrifying looking medical tool. Nuts to that! Attack!)
You have brought illness and corruption into my sanctuary. Begone.

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures take 25% less damage from {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_POISON}.
cardBonuses.5: Your creatures take 25% less damage from {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_BURNED}.
cardBonuses.8: Your creatures take 25% less damage from {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_BLEED}.

master.dialog: Plague Doctors are not only the coolest-looking creatures in Rodia, they're some of the most powerful as well! I'm a firm believer that actions speak louder than words, so let me show you their power firsthand!
master.name: Doctor Negative

name: Plague Doctor

bossDialog: (A huge fox leaps into your path, whirling its tails around and crackling with magical energy as it growls and approaches. You have your creatures answer the threat head-on!)
(Atop the treasure, the Vulpes issues several screeching yaps before it turns and notices you, shocked at your presence. You seem to have interrupted something, and it isn't happy about it!)
(The Vulpes sitting on the treasure hoard gives you a condescending look as it begins to charge a spell. Having no particular desire to get zapped, you have your creatures quickly attack!)

cardBonuses.2: Enemies' Spell Gems have 10% fewer {STAT_charges}.
cardBonuses.5: Enemies' Spell Gems have 10% fewer {STAT_charges}.
cardBonuses.8: Enemies' Spell Gems have 10% fewer {STAT_charges}.

master.dialog: Vulpes are fantastic spellcasters who prefer to do all the heavy lifting at the very start of battle. In other words, I'm probably going to win this battle before you get a chance to make a move. Farewell!
master.name: Benedict

name: Vulpes

bossDialog: (As the Stag's antlers begin to glow, a group it seems to have allied itself with emerge from the shadows to confront you as one!)
(Following a bellowing cry that freezes you dead in your tracks, a massive Stag charges out from the shadows of the room with murderous intent!)
(The Stag stands above the treasure hoard, gazing down at you with contempt. It leaps down to block you from approaching any further.)

cardBonuses.2: You gain 30% more {RES_POWER} from battles.
cardBonuses.5: Increases the base amount of {RES_POWER} gained from battles by 15.
cardBonuses.8: You have a 15% chance to gain double {RES_POWER} from battles.

master.dialog: Stags are the only creatures in Rodia that have the ability to unlock the true potential of Spell Gems. If you think you can stand up against my army of spellcasters, then let's have ourselves a duel!
master.name: Folo

name: Stag

bossDialog: (Curled up and sitting on top of the treasure, the Basilisk snarls more and more the closer you get. You'll have to defeat it to get the treasure!)
(Shrieking and ruffling its scales, the Basilisk charges head-first into your monsters in a vicious rage!)
(The Basilisk rouses itself, clearly very unhappy about having been woken up. With an echoing cry, it attacks with its companions!)

cardBonuses.2: Enemies take 3% more damage.
cardBonuses.4: Enemies take 3% more damage.
cardBonuses.7: Enemies take 3% more damage.

master.dialog: If you want to stand a chance against my Basilisks, you'd better make sure you damage them between each of their turns. Otherwise, you'll be in for a world of hurt! Let's see what you've got!
master.name: Searle

name: Basilisk

bossDialog: (A Salamander seems to have made its nest in this abandoned treasure hoard, and it doesn't look like it wants to share it with you.)
(You feel your enchanted items heating up and vibrating as you approach. You hope the Salamander hasn't damaged the treasure hoard it jealously guards.)
(You narrowly dodge a glob of searing spit as you approach the hissing Salamander. You order your creatures to attack!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures gain 10% more {STAT_intelligence} from stat-boosting effects.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures gain 10% more {STAT_intelligence} from stat-boosting effects.
cardBonuses.7: Your creatures gain 10% more {STAT_intelligence} from stat-boosting effects.

master.dialog: Salamanders are proficient spellslingers who can cast spells multiple times in a row. I hope your creatures can handle the heat! Let's fight!
master.name: Jaytir

name: Salamander

master.dialog: Ah, it's good to see you again, old friend!\n\nHow about a duel for old time's sake? No need to hold back - I want to see how strong you've grown since we last fought!
master.name: Lucius, King of Nex

cardBonuses.3: You gain 5% more Notoriety from the Gambling Dwarves.
cardBonuses.6: You gain 5% more Notoriety from the Gambling Dwarves.
cardBonuses.10: You gain 5% more Notoriety from the Gambling Dwarves.

master.dialog: Alementals are... well, they don't have much in the way of a unifying theme across the entire race, but they DO urinate booze on command, so there's that. Care for a round? It's on me.
master.name: Furnace, Brother of Furness

cardBonuses.3: You gain 5% more Glory from the Arena.
cardBonuses.6: You gain 5% more Glory from the Arena.
cardBonuses.10: You gain 5% more Glory from the Arena.

master.dialog: Constructs utilize powerful Arsenal Spells to destroy their foes. Let's see if you can handle them!
master.name: Monos

bossDialog: I just found this treasure! It's MINE! Get outta here!
I'm not going to let some greedy human bag of snot steal everything I've worked for!
Oh dear, this is supposed to be a secret hideout! I think it's time for you to leave.

cardBonuses.2: When your creatures with {CONDNAME_BUFF_REBIRTH} are resurrected, they recover an additional 15% {STAT_health}.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures with {CONDNAME_BUFF_REBIRTH} receive 10% more healing.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures' {CONDNAME_BUFF_REBIRTH} buff lasts forever.

master.dialog: Amphisbaenas like to do everything twice. Probably because they have two heads with two independent yet agreeable minds. Here, let me show you!
master.name: Leftrin

name: Amphisbaena

bossDialog: I PROTECT THIS TREASURE. INTRUDERS WILL BE SLAIN. YOU ARE AN INTRUDER. PLEASE IMMEDIATELY PERISH IN AN EFFICIENT MANNER.
INTRUDER. ELIMINATE. INTRUDER. ELIMINATE.
PROTECT THE TREASURE.

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures deal 15% more damage with start-of-battle effects.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures deal 15% more damage with start-of-battle effects.

(You try to sneak up to the treasure hoard, but the Cockatrice wakes up and immediately makes a tremendously dangerous nuisance of itself. It just isn't your lucky day.)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures have 1 more base {STAT_attack}.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures have 1 more base {STAT_attack}.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures have 1 more base {STAT_attack}.

name: Cockatrice

bossDialog: (A barely identifiable, fleshy chunk drops to the ground before you with a sickening, crunchy splat, and quickly pulls itself together and prepares to attack!)

(What you thought was a particularly large growth of mold in the corner begins to move, rising up and dragging itself towards you while emitting disgusting noises!)

cardBonuses.2: Enemies take 20% more damage from {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_BLIGHT}.
cardBonuses.4: Enemies receive 20% more healing while they're afflicted with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_BLIGHT}.

name: Sea Shambler

bossDialog: Come here, you weak little shrimp! I'm gonna fry you to a crisp!
I've already thought of fifty different ways to defeat you. Now, which one should I use?
Ugh. I JUST got set up in this little hideout, and you dolts come blundering in here! Out, out, out!

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures deal 10% more damage while it is not their turn.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures deal 10% more damage while it is not their turn.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures deal 10% more damage while it is not their turn.

name: Sparktail

bossDialog: (A mass of vines and roots suddenly shifts with a rustling sound, soon revealing an immense plantlike jaw - one that clearly intends to make you its next meal!)
(What you thought was a normal plant suddenly tries to bite you as you pass by it! That'll teach you to not pay attention to completely innocuous looking plants.)
(You hear the shaking of leaves as a large Snaptrap hefts itself into a coiled position, ready to strike at you! You're not getting the treasure without dealing with it first!)

cardBonuses.2: Enemies have a 1% chance to start battles at the bottom of the {TIMELINE}.
cardBonuses.4: Enemies have a 1% chance to start battles at the bottom of the {TIMELINE}.
cardBonuses.6: Enemies have a 1% chance to start battles at the bottom of the {TIMELINE}.

master.dialog: My Snaptraps are about to ruin your day! Your creatures won't be making a move anytime soon, I can assure you of that!

bossDialog: (As you begin to notice that the room is unusually dark, the shadows in the room all begin to converge on a single point. You ready your creatures for a fight.)

(One of your creatures suddenly shoves into you, barging you aside! As you turn to admonish it, you notice it grappling with a creature that had been posing as your shadow to ambush you!)

cardBonuses.2: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_FEAR} take 10% more damage.

master.name: Roland

name: Shadow

bossDialog: (As you approach the treasure hoard, a dark creature rises and begins to erase the treasure! You'll have to act now if there's going to be any of it left to claim!)
(Ordering your creatures to attack the Voidlord before you, you prepare a spell of escape in advance, just in case. It's a lot better than being erased from reality.)
(Though these creatures have only come to Rodia recently, you know very well the danger they pose. Casting several protective wards as a precaution, you order your creatures into battle!)

cardBonuses.2: Your {CONDNAME_BUFF_REPELLING} creatures take 5% less damage from spells.
cardBonuses.4: Your {CONDNAME_BUFF_REPELLING} creatures take 5% less damage from attacks.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures' {CONDNAME_BUFF_REPELLING} buff now lasts forever.

master.dialog: Your creatures will never penetrate my Voidlords' defenses! Do you really think you stand a chance against me? Let's find out!

name: Voidlord

bossDialog: (A bizarre and unintelligible voice rings around the room as a pink flame ignites in the air before you, staring you down menacingly before attacking!)
(The treasure hoard seems to be haunted by a malevolent entity. It manifests a sinister leer as you approach, as if daring you to attack it. You promptly oblige.)
(You feel an intense heat on the back of your neck, and turn around just in time to avoid a Wisp trying to scorch you! Your creatures intercept it and attack!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures have a 5% chance to resist effects that cause them to fall to the bottom of the {TIMELINE}.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures have a 5% chance to resist effects that cause them to fall to the bottom of the {TIMELINE}.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures have a 5% chance to resist effects that cause them to fall to the bottom of the {TIMELINE}.

master.dialog: Wisps are some of the most powerful creatures in Rodia, but admittedly, they have one glaring weakness: they can be disrupted very, very easily. Even so, if you don't manage to interrupt my Wisps in time, they'll make quick work of your creatures. Let me show you!
master.name: Verdun

name: Wisp

bossDialog: (At first appearing as a lump on the floor, the Leech bolts upright as you approach, waving its heads around and making repulsive sounds. It lumbers towards you and attacks!)
(The strange creature flops around almost comedically, trying to get to you. It's a good thing you know how dangerous Leeches are, lest you be caught off guard.)
(You hear a disgusting slurping noise as the Leech raises up, a now-desiccated corpse falling from one of its mouths. It clearly intends to make you its next meal!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures recover 20% more {STAT_health} from {CONDNAME_BUFF_LEECH}.
cardBonuses.4: When your creatures recover {STAT_health} from {CONDNAME_BUFF_LEECH}, the amount of healing has a 25% chance to be doubled.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures' {CONDNAME_BUFF_LEECH} buff lasts forever.

master.dialog: Anyone who's anyone will admit that Leeches are some of the most disgusting creatures on the planet, but I'll be damned if they don't make for fantastic combatants on the battlefield. It's time for my Leeches to suck your creatures dry!
master.name: Vesh

name: Leech

bossDialog: ...Blood... Blood...? BLOOD! GIVE ME YOUR BLOOD!
Ah, a source of fresh blood. Come forth, and give me that which makes you live!
I'm going to drain every last drop of blood from you and everyone you love!

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures gain 5% more stats from stat-boosting effects.
cardBonuses.4: Enemies lose 5% more stats from stat-reducing effects.
cardBonuses.6: Doubles the potency of these effects.

master.dialog: Hemomancers are great for stealing their enemies' stats and distributing them to your other creatures. Your creatures won't stand a chance after my Hemomancers have leached all their strength away!
master.name: Luv

name: Hemomancer

bossDialog: (A powerful construct hewn of bones and various magical trinkets has been set to guard this treasure hoard. It's not going to let you pass without a fight!)
(Several dry old skeletons that you thought were simply remains of old adventurers all jump to their feet, and assemble together to make a much bigger, stronger looking creature!)
(You hear clattering and clacking as bones roll together into a pile from all across the room, soon assembling themselves into a powerful-looking shape to battle you with!)

cardBonuses.2: Enemies resurrect with 5% less {STAT_health}.
cardBonuses.4: Enemies resurrect with 5% less {STAT_health}.
cardBonuses.6: Enemies resurrect with 5% less {STAT_health}.

master.dialog: You can't kill an Ossein. Not permanently, anyway. They always manage to find a way to piece themselves back together again and raise hell for everyone once more. Oh, by the way - my entire party is full of the damn things! Let's fight!
master.name: Graft

name: Ossein

bossDialog: (There are a LOT of bloodstains in this room. The Eft that is no doubt responsible for them looks up from a carcass it was eating and charges at you, hoping to add you to its pantry!)
(You hear a low, guttural growl that chills you to the bone - you soon see an Eft climbing down the wall, on its way to attack you and your creatures!)
(You spot an Eft guarding the treasure and steel your resolve - the level of violence these creatures can inflict is legendary. Get ready for a fight!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures have 1 more base {STAT_speed}.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures have 1 more base {STAT_speed}.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures have 1 more base {STAT_speed}.

master.dialog: Efts are pack hunters who are great at weakening their enemies before closing in for the kill. You don't stand a chance against me!
master.name: Heafy

name: Eft

bossDialog: Hmmmm, hmmmm, yes; strong, healthy, I could definitely use you. Do come along quietly without a fight, little thing.
Oh look, another weary and tired traveler. Stay a while.... stay FOREVER!
Oh, you poor little thing. You have no idea what you've just gotten yourself into, do you?

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures' minions have a 5% lower chance to go away.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures' minions have a 5% lower chance to go away.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures' minions have a 5% lower chance to go away.

master.name: Ridley

name: Inquisitor

bossDialog: (The Satyr is stumbling around, clearly drunk out of its mind. After spotting you it yells belligerently and charges right at you!)
Hmph. You don't look like much. You wanna fight?
Maybe if I give you a good thrashing, you'll learn not to go poking your nose into random caves and rooms.

cardBonuses.2: At the start of battle, enemies' Spell Gems each have a 3% chance to be Sealed.
cardBonuses.4: At the start of battle, enemies' Spell Gems each have a 3% chance to be Sealed.

master.dialog: I hope you have a flexible battle strategy, because my Satyrs are going to foil any plans you've made ahead of time! Come, my little hooved children, let us ruin this SPEC_NOT_FOUND: 's day!
master.name: Henrick

name: Satyr

bossDialog: How bold of you to seek me out. I welcome your challenge. Let us fight...
My blade, your wit. Which shall be found to be sharper?
You've got some nerve challenging the likes of I.

name: Koloss

bossDialog: A soul as weak and dainty as yours is hardly a morsel to one such as I.
Another naive little human, here to steal my treasure. Choke on your own greed, you insipid fool.
Your curiosity has finally led you to your grave. Be thankful you won't have long to regret it!

cardBonuses.2: You have a 5% chance to gain double resources from breakable objects.
cardBonuses.4: You have a 5% chance to gain double resources from breakable objects.
cardBonuses.6: You have a 5% chance to gain double resources from breakable objects.

bossDialog: (A truly bizarre looking creature rises from the treasure hoard and points at you menacingly. You're not just going to sit and take that kind of treatment, are you?)

(The Unguided levitates a treasure chest into the air and hurls it at you. You barely duck in time, hoping that there was nothing fragile in that chest as you prepare to attack!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures have 1 more base {STAT_health}.

cardBonuses.6: Your creatures have 1 more base {STAT_health}.

(You hear a sloshing noise and barely have time to realize what's going on before your creatures pull you out of the way of a Concoction rising from the ground beneath you!)

THIS is MY treasure! YOU can't HAVE it! haHAhaHAhaHA!

cardBonuses.4: Your creatures deal 35% more damage while they're dead.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures deal 35% more damage while they're dead.

name: Toxdweller

master.name: Uncle Carb

name: Carbuncle

bossDialog: (A particularly large jewel with an eye embedded inside begins to float in the air, drawing in all the ambient magical energy for a no doubt sinister purpose. Better put a stop to that.)

(The Gemling has done nothing but silently and judgmentally stare at you non-stop since you entered the room. Time to teach it that it's rude to stare!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures' Ethereal Spell Gems heal 15% more.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures' Ethereal Spell Gems increase/decrease stats 15% more.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures' Ethereal Spell Gems deal 15% more damage.

master.dialog: Gemlings are as strong as they are gorgeous. They can power up your other creatures' Spell Gems to make them a force to be reckoned with. Let me show you in a duel!

name: Gemling

bossDialog: (The Cruncher seems to have found this treasure hoard before you, and is currently making a lavish meal of it! You'll have to act now if there's going to be any left to take!)
(What you thought was a tremendously large gemstone among the treasure suddenly sprouts limbs and a rather grumpy-looking beaked face, and emits a low growl while staring right at you!)
(You approach the treasure, but notice that there seem to be several bite-shaped chunks missing. You spot a large turtle nearby ambling towards you, magical "crumbs" around its beak!)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures deal 3% more damage to enemies for each Sealed Spell Gem the enemy has.

name: Cruncher

bossDialog: (A magical being looks up from a book it was reading, then calmly sets it aside and begins to approach you with a weapon drawn. Your creatures move to block it and it immediately adopts a combat stance!)
(Little is known of the Nihilists, so you decide to approach with as much caution as possible. This creature could be capable of anything.)
(Poised gracefully atop the treasure, a slender figure leaps into your path and begins to twirl a weapon with expert skill. It clearly has no intention of allowing you to claim the treasure.)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures' Spell Gems have a 5% chance to not consume {STAT_charges}.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures' Spell Gems have a 5% chance to not consume {STAT_charges}.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures' Spell Gems have a 5% chance to not consume {STAT_charges}.

master.dialog: Nihilists channel unimaginable power that, if properly employed, can wreak havoc on your foes. The drawback of Nihilists is that they overflow with so much strength that their enemies tend to be able to draw from this power as well. A seasoned tactician is capable of mitigating this downside to ensure victory. Let's fight!
master.name: Honas

name: Nihilist

bossDialog: (An unusual mechanical creature in the shape of an insect skitters forward maliciously. You consider it a shame to destroy such a beautifully crafted construct, but your survival cannot be compromised.)

(Hearing a suspicious click, you barely have time to react as an arc of energy streams forth, scorching the ground where you stood. The creature that fired it soon appears to attack you more directly!)
(Your ears begin to ring as a strange, translucent insect approaches you emitting a high pitched whine. Something about it unnerves you so much, you immediately order your creatures to step on it!)

cardBonuses.2: You gain 30% more {RES_ESSENCE} from battles.
cardBonuses.4: Increases the base amount of {RES_ESSENCE} gained from battles by 15.
cardBonuses.6: You have a 15% chance to gain double {RES_ESSENCE} from battles.

master.dialog: Electropods are all about speed, speed, and more speed!\n\nVroom vroom, mother!@#$er.
master.name: Gren

name: Electropod

bossDialog: (A tiny embryo floats in the air, wreathed in a potent field of magical energy. Suppressing your guilt at having to use force on something so young, you prepare to attack!)
(As soon as it notices your presence, the Cherub begins to radiate massive amounts of power. It needs to be stopped before it gets too intense and brings the whole room down upon you!)
(Knowing well how dangerous these unassuming creatures can be, you order your creatures to be extremely cautious in dealing with it while you stand back with an escape spell at the ready.)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures take 0.5% less damage from attacks for each buff they have.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures take 0.5% less damage from spells for each buff they have.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures take 0.5% less indirect damage for each buff they have.

master.dialog: Cherubs are defensive creatures who utilize powerful barriers to keep them safe from harm. Push their limits too much, however, and you'll be on the receiving end of unimaginable offensive power as well. Allow me to demonstrate!
master.name: Claas

name: Cherub

bossDialog: ALLOCATING POWER. INITIATING ATTACK STRATEGY.
ERROR: INVALID PARAMETER AT COORDINATE 0X:-1Y. ENGAGING DEFAULT BEHAVIOR ROUTINE KillAllIntruders().
HOSTILE ORGANISM DETECTED. LAUNCHING SLAUGHTER PROTOCOL.

cardBonuses.2: You gain 30% more {RES_POWER} from battles.
cardBonuses.4: Increases the base amount of {RES_POWER} gained from battles by 15.
cardBonuses.6: You have a 15% chance to gain double {RES_POWER} from battles.

master.dialog: Modrons are defensive creatures that are able to shrug off even the most brutal of ailments. There's not much to be said for them when it comes to offense, but if you're looking for a creature to protect your team, you need not look further than the Modron race. Let me show you!
master.name: Sotvis

name: Modron

bossDialog: (An unusual machine near the treasure hoard whirls to face you as you approach the treasure, brandishing weapons as it does so. You'll have to clear it out of the way to get to the treasure!)

(Gears and cogs levitate from the floor and assemble themselves into a strange form, which begins to approach you menacingly! You do not know what kind of technology or sorcery this is, only that you will not tolerate threats.)

(You've heard an incessant ticking noise ever since you entered the room, and you seem to have found the source - an incomprehensible tangle of gears and other mechanical pieces. Eager to make the ticking stop, you order your creatures to smash it!)

cardBonuses.2: You gain 30% more {RES_GRANITE} from battles.
cardBonuses.4: Increases the base amount of {RES_GRANITE} gained from battles by 15.
cardBonuses.6: You have a 15% chance to gain double {RES_GRANITE} from battles.

master.dialog: Clockworks may be slow to build their power, but once they do, they're practically unstoppable. Let me show you how it's done!
master.name: Aizur

name: Clockwork

bossDialog: I shall not be your adjudicator this day, traveler; your trials yet continue. Even so, I shall test your worthiness.
Ruler of {CASTLENAME}, the charges leveled against you are most grave. I pronounce you guilty, and hereby sentence you to death!
You are untested. I challenge you - trial by combat. Prove the worth of your existence.

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures have a 3% chance to ignore incoming debuffs.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures have a 3% chance to ignore incoming debuffs.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures have a 3% chance to ignore incoming debuffs.

master.dialog: Arbiters emit powerful auras that strengthen their allies in battle. If you wish to stand a chance against me, you'll need to pick off my Arbiters one at a time. Let's fight!
master.name: Clovis

name: Arbiter

bossDialog: (A huge moth flutters around the room above you, scattering dust behind it. As you begin to feel drowsy, you focus on staying awake and have your creatures attack it before things get any worse!)

(As you stare at some strange looking caterpillars on the wall, their parent suddenly appears and flutters at you furiously, charging magical energy! Your creatures intercept it and a fight breaks out!)
(Pulling itself out of the treasure pile, the Luckmantria beats its wings at you, angrily trying to shoo you out of the room! You didn't know bugs collected treasure until today.)

cardBonuses.2: Riddle Dwarves have a 10% greater chance to spawn in Realms.
cardBonuses.4: Riddle Dwarves have a 10% greater chance to spawn in Realms.
cardBonuses.6: Riddle Dwarves reward 1 additional ticket.

master.dialog: Luckmantrias are adept at manipulating their foes to suit their needs. These creatures may be difficult to master, but in the right hands, nothing is better than an army of Luckmantrias fighting by your side. Let's duel!
master.name: Vuth

name: Luckmantria

bossDialog: Many have tried to end my life. I survived, they didn't. Still fancy your chances, punk?
Never defeated! Never retreated! U-ra-los! U-ra-los! RAAAAAHH!!!
The songs of my victory here will be sung forever! Are you prepared to become a footnote in my legend?!

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures' Relics modify stats 5% more.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures' Relics modify stats 5% more.
cardBonuses.7: Your creatures' Relics modify stats 5% more.

master.dialog: Uraloses rely on the strength of cooperation with their kin in order to bolster their power in battle. They also loath bear jokes, so mind your tongue, will you?\n\nSeriously? "Bear naked"? That's your joke? You truly find that funny? Prepare to die!
master.name: Chum

name: Uralos

bossDialog: (A bizarre hybridized creature stands before you, brandishing weapons. Your thoughts turn briefly to the fusion station in your castle, wondering if this was some form of fusing mishap. Either way, it needs to die before you can claim your prize.)
(Sinister magic hangs around this creature like a curse. You do not know what this thing's origin is; only where you're about to send it.)

(The Chimera begins to yell incomprehensible words at you from all of its heads at once, and a few of its limbs. This creature is clearly an affront to decent biology and putting it down will surely give your kingdom's bestiary keepers a good night's sleep.)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures' Nether Stones are 5% more powerful.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures' Nether Stones are 5% more powerful.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures' Nether Stones are 5% more powerful.

master.dialog: Who doesn't enjoy a good Fusion? Well, I happen to be a bit more obsessed about it than most people, and that's why I employ the skills of Chimeras. Chimeras utilize their fusions to their fullest potential, enabling them to far-surpass the strength of other creatures. Have a look for yourself!
master.name: Bekhud

name: Chimera

bossDialog: (A truly weird creature suddenly manifests before you - an oversized limb wreathed in neon green flames. Not wanting it to touch you, you order your creatures to deal with it instead.)

(An enlarged body part hovers in the air before you, approaching you with intent. You're not really sure how you determine a disembodied creature part's intent, only that you can and it needs stopping.)
(You confusedly wonder if the enchanted body part floating infront of you belongs to someone. One way or another, you doubt they're going to get it back.)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures recover 50% more {STAT_health} from enemies' {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_INVERTED} debuff.
cardBonuses.4: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_INVERTED} take 10% more damage.
cardBonuses.6: Enemies take 20% more damage from their {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_INVERTED} debuffs.

master.dialog: What might appear as a generic ear, nose, or eyeball to you is, in reality, a core component of my army. Prepare to be decimated by random, severed body parts!
master.name: Obert

name: Animation

bossDialog: Big, ugly giant! You can't catch me! Nya nya nya-\n\n(You grab one of the fairies out of the air and eat it to show you're not going to be taunted. Horrified, the rest of the fairies attack!)
Heehee! Look, friends, a new plaything for us! A silly looking one, too!
Hey! Listen! I'll give you some useful advice; get out of my treasure room before I rip your skin off!

cardBonuses.2: You gain 30% more {RES_CRYSTAL} from battles.
cardBonuses.4: Increases the base amount of {RES_CRYSTAL} gained from battles by 15.
cardBonuses.6: You have a 15% chance to gain double {RES_CRYSTAL} from battles.

master.dialog: Fae may be small in appearance, but get enough of them together and you'll be in for quite a nasty surprise! Sure, their personalities leave much to be desired, but there's no creatures I'd rather have on my side than a pack of Fae. Allow me to introduce you to mine!
master.name: Sylphe

name: Fae

bossDialog: (Feeling the hair on your arms stand on end, you approach the Spellmane as it issues a low, deep growl before pouncing! Your creatures intercept the attack!)
(Issuing a loud roaring shriek, the huge cat tethered to the treasure makes enough noise to attract the owners of the hoard! They use cats as guard dogs too now, you guess.)
Whoosh! Whoosh! Grrrrrrr!

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures' [temporary] Ethereal Spell Gems deal 10% more damage.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures' [temporary] Ethereal Spell Gems grant 10% more healing.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures' [temporary] Ethereal Spell Gems grant 10% more stats.

master.dialog: Spellmanes have the unique ability to draw power from the spells they cast, hiding themselves from harm while planning a devastating follow-up attack.\n\nDo you dare challenge my Spellmanes to battle? Very well. Let's fight!
master.name: Vindeliar

name: Spellmane

bossDialog: (Rooting around in the treasure hoard, the Warhog looks up from it, pieces of half-chewed treasure stuck in its teeth. These ridiculous things will eat anything - including you, if you're not careful!)

(Suddenly woken up by your approach, the giant beast screeches at the top of its lungs as it rolls around trying to get up sending treasure flying everywhere. Attracted to the wealth on offer, more creatures show up to fight you for it!)
(The biggest eyeless pig you've ever seen suddenly crashes through the wall and comes charging right at you! You're certainly glad there's only one, and not thirty to fifty of them.)

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures have a 3% chance to avoid damage from attacks.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures have a 3% chance to avoid damage from spells.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures have a 3% chance to avoid indirect damage.

master.dialog: Warhogs afflict their unfortunate foes with all manner of deadly ailments. Then, they use their opponent's ailments to grow more powerful and ensure an easy victory. Prepare yourself!
master.name: Zotar

name: Warhog

bossDialog: Grant me thy kindness, thy compassion, the warmth of thy heart; that I might grind them to ash 'neath my heel.
I shalt have thee for a servant to pain and ruin, else I shalt have thee dead. Perhaps I shalt have both.
I smell the blood of thousands upon thy hands, varlet. Thou'rt not one so far removed from the art of malice that thou canst truly balk at mine invitation to embrace it.

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures' Relics deal 5% more damage.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures' Relics deal 5% more damage.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures' Relics deal 5% more damage.

master.dialog: Nephilims symbolize balance in all things. Practicing moderation is the key to success. Allow me to demonstrate.
master.name: Diablo

name: Nephilim

bossDialog: (A deep and guttural sound issues forth from beneath you; you and your creatures jump back just in time for a Kraken to break through the floor from a deep pool beneath it, looking for its next meal!)

(As you approach the treasure hoard on a small island in the room, huge tentacles rise up from the water followed by a rather angry-looking head. The Kraken clearly has no intention of letting you take its treasure!)

(One of the biggest cephalopods you've ever seen has its tentacles greedily curled around the pile of treasure, and it begins eyeing you with a covetous gaze as you approach. Take care to not be added to its treasure hoard...)

cardBonuses.2: You gain 30% more {RES_BRIMSTONE} from battles.
cardBonuses.4: Increases the base amount of {RES_BRIMSTONE} gained from battles by 15.
cardBonuses.6: You have a 15% chance to gain double {RES_BRIMSTONE} from battles.

master.dialog: Hello! What's Kraken?\n\nThat's all I have to say, really. I'm not all too sure how Krakens operate, but no one else wanted this job, so here I am. Let's fight!
master.name: Wim

name: Kraken

bossDialog: Are you lost? I can light the way out for you if you want.\n\n...you're here to kill me? Then how about I show you to your grave instead?!
Look, can we negotiate this? We really don't have to fight, you know... oh, who am I kidding. When did that ever work?
Sorry, this treasure's mine, I've just been trying to count it. Hey, why are your creatures unsheathing their weapo-

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures' Artifacts' "Strength" properties are 10% more powerful.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures' Artifacts' "Strength" properties are 10% more powerful.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures' Artifacts' "Strength" properties are 10% more powerful.

master.dialog: Beacons empower their allies in a variety of interesting ways depending on their class. No team is complete without a Beacon at the helm, I say. Let's fight!
master.name: Pepi

name: Beacon

bossDialog: Regard me now with consternation - the agent of your own annihilation!
Words of where you fell defeated - time shall find them oft repeated!
You came so far, only to fail - a sordid end to your woeful tale!

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures' Relics heal for 5% more.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures' Relics heal for 5% more.
cardBonuses.7: Your creatures' Relics heal for 5% more.

master.dialog: Never let anyone tell you you Mythicant. Because you Mythican. I'm living proof that if you believe in yourself, you Mythican do anything. Let me show you just how far I've come!
master.name: Gir

name: Mythicant

bossDialog: (A small doll sits innocuously atop the treasure pile. As you approach, it twitches to life, pins and needles protruding from its cloth body as it fixes its button eyes on you!)
(The Effigy raises a tiny arm, and suddenly you feel a sharp pain in your chest. It seems to be controlling a voodoo doll of you! Your creatures rush to attack it before it can do more harm!)
Your pain... my pleasure... Come closer... Feel the prick of my needles and share your agony with me!

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures take 3% less indirect damage.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures take 3% less indirect damage.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures take 3% less indirect damage.

master.dialog: Effigies are masters of sympathetic magic - what happens to the doll happens to you! Every pin, every needle, every tiny stitch connects directly to your creatures' pain centers. My collection of voodoo dolls has grown quite impressive, but I always have room for more. Allow me to demonstrate the exquisite agony my Effigies can inflict!
master.name: Gideon

name: Effigy

bossDialog: (A massive dragon-like creature descends from a hidden perch, wings outstretched as it lands atop the treasure pile with surprising grace for its size!)
(The Lucanian's scales begin to glow with an inner heat as it inhales deeply, preparing to unleash its fiery breath upon you and your creatures!)
You seek to steal from a descendant of dragons? Your arrogance will be your undoing, human!

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures have 3% more {STAT_attack} and {STAT_intelligence}.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures have 3% more {STAT_attack} and {STAT_intelligence}.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures have 3% more {STAT_attack} and {STAT_intelligence}.

master.dialog: Lucanians carry the ancient wisdom and power of dragons in their veins! Their scales can withstand the fiercest attacks, and their draconic breath can reduce opponents to cinders in seconds. I've spent years earning the respect of these noble creatures, and now their flames burn for my glory. Prepare to feel the heat of my Lucanian legion!
master.name: Myxus

name: Lucanian

bossDialog: (One particularly large egg suddenly hatches, releasing not a creature but a cloud of hallucinogenic spores! Your creatures shake their heads, trying to clear their senses as the Eggxotic attack!)
(The Eggxotic cluster rolls and bounces erratically across the treasure pile, making it hard to predict where they'll strike from next. Their shells are tougher than they look!)
(What appeared to be decorative eggs among the treasure suddenly crack open, revealing a cluster of strange, chirping creatures who immediately form a defensive circle around the hoard!)

cardBonuses.2: You have a 1% chance to receive treasure after battle.
cardBonuses.4: You have a 2% chance to receive treasure after battle.
cardBonuses.6: You have a 3% chance to receive treasure after battle.

master.dialog: Don't let their fragile appearance fool you - Eggxotics are full of surprises! Those shells are tougher than they look, and what hatches from inside can be... unpredictable. My Eggxotics work together in perfect harmony, rolling and bouncing in formations that will leave your creatures dizzy and confused. Ready to crack under the pressure?
master.name: Yolkina

name: Eggxotic

bossDialog: (A strange feline creature in what appears to be some kind of space suit materializes in front of the treasure, defying gravity as it floats above the hoard with a predatory gleam in its eyes!)
(The Spacecat's helmet visor glows with unearthly light as it manipulates the very gravity around you, making your creatures stumble as they try to approach!)
I've hunted prey across seventeen galaxies, human. You're barely worth sharpening my claws on!

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures' Spell Gems that belong to other classes have 5% more potency.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures' Spell Gems that belong to other classes have 5% more potency.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures' Spell Gems that belong to other classes have 5% more potency.

master.dialog: Spacecats have traversed the cosmos and mastered gravitational manipulation! Their alien technology allows them to float effortlessly while raining down attacks from above. My Spacecats have hunted prey across seventeen galaxies, bringing extraterrestrial hunting techniques to Rodia. Shall I tell you about the things they've seen beyond our stars? Or would you prefer a demonstration?
master.name: Felindra

name: Spacecat

bossDialog: (A robed figure tosses glowing orbs of magic from hand to hand with casual expertise, each one pulsing with different deadly energies as it guards the treasure before you!)
(The Spelljuggler laughs maniacally as it begins to weave the orbs into complex patterns, creating a magical barrier between you and the treasure that grows more dangerous by the second!)
Care to catch a spell, mortal? I have so many I'm just dying to share with you!

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures deal 1% more damage for each equipped permanent Spell Gem that belongs to another class.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures deal 1% more damage for each equipped permanent Spell Gem that belongs to another class.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures deal 1% more damage for each equipped permanent Spell Gem that belongs to another class.

master.dialog: Spelljugglers are the most talented magical artists in all of Rodia! They can toss and combine spells with such dexterity that even experienced mages stand in awe. My Spelljugglers have mastered spells that would make your head spin - literally! Care to catch a spell? I promise, you'll find their magical performance absolutely mind-blowing!
master.name: Trisand

name: Spelljuggler

bossDialog: (The Calumnier coils itself around the treasure hoard, its scales gleaming as it hisses a challenge. Its tail swishes back and forth, ready to strike!)
(The Calumnier gives you a predatory smile as it slithers forward, blocking your path to the treasure with surprising speed and aggression!)
You dare to think yourself worthy of these treasures? I'll add your bones to my collection after I've finished with you!

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures gain 3% (additive) more benefit from their Personalities.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures gain 3% (additive) more benefit from their Personalities.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures gain 3% (additive) more benefit from their Personalities.

master.dialog: Calumniers are strategic fighters with scales harder than forged steel. When they work together, they're practically invincible! Their elegant yet deadly fighting style has earned them respect across all of Rodia. You'll soon learn why my Calumniers are feared in battle - their scales gleam brightest when covered in enemy blood!
master.name: Lysandre

name: Calumnier

bossDialog: (Hanging from invisible strings above the treasure hoard, the Marionette twitches to life as you approach, its painted smile turning sinister as it reaches for weapons hidden among the gold!)
(The Marionette suddenly goes limp, then jerks upright with renewed vigor as spectral strings pull it into an impossible combat stance. Whatever controls this puppet clearly means business!)
My strings may be pulled by another, but your fate is in MY hands now, little thief!

cardBonuses.3: Your creatures have a 2% chance to take another turn.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures have a 2% chance to take another turn.
cardBonuses.9: Your creatures have a 2% chance to take another turn.

master.dialog: Marionettes may seem like mere puppets, but the strings that control them connect to powers beyond your understanding! They dance between life and death with uncanny grace, and their painted smiles hide deadly intent. My Marionettes move to my rhythm, and today, they'll dance your creatures right into their graves!
master.name: Phantril

name: Marionette

bossDialog: (The Elementasaur rears up on its hind legs, towering over you as primal magical energy swirls around its body, collecting in its gaping maw for a devastating attack!)
(The ground trembles as a massive reptilian creature stomps forward, its hide crackling with elemental energies that leave scorch marks and frost patches wherever it steps!)
RAAAWWRR! Tiny human think can take MY treasure? Elementasaur crush you, then burn you, then freeze what's left!

cardBonuses.3: Your creatures' debuffs each have a 3% chance to be removed at the start of their turns.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures' debuffs each have a 3% chance to be removed at the start of their turns.
cardBonuses.9: Your creatures' debuffs each have a 3% chance to be removed at the start of their turns.

master.dialog: Elementasaurs command the primal forces of nature through their ancient, magical hides! Fire, frost, lightning - all the elements bend to their will. The wisdom of the ancients and raw elemental power are mine to command through my Elementasaur companions. Their thunderous footsteps have made kingdoms tremble - yours will be no different!
master.name: Ryzon

name: Elementasaur

bossDialog: (The mechanical guardian's eyes glow a menacing red as panels on its body slide open to reveal an alarming array of weapons pointed directly at you!)
ALERT: UNAUTHORIZED LIFEFORM DETECTED. TREASURE PROTECTION PROTOCOL ACTIVATED. COMMENCING TERMINATION SEQUENCE.
ANALYSIS COMPLETE. PROBABILITY OF YOUR SURVIVAL: 0.0%. RECOMMENDATION: ACCEPT YOUR FATE QUIETLY.

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures have a 10% chance to avoid instant-kill effects.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures have a 10% chance to avoid instant-kill effects.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures have a 10% chance to avoid instant-kill effects.

master.dialog: Robodomi represent the perfect marriage of magic and machinery! Their processors can calculate a million battle strategies per second, and their shields are impenetrable to conventional attacks. My mechanical army operates at peak efficiency, with each unit networked for optimal performance. PREPARE FOR SYSTEMATIC ELIMINATION OF ALL OPPOSITION.
master.name: Machinist K-42

name: Robodomi

cardBonuses.3: L_CARD_FALSEGODSPAWN1
cardBonuses.6: L_CARD_FALSEGODSPAWN2

bossDialog: (A pale, twisted creature emerges from a crack in the floor, its eyes squinting painfully in the light as it hisses and spreads clawed hands protectively over the treasure!)

(The Underdweller begins to mutter strange words, and the shadows in the room seem to deepen and twist toward you with malicious intent. This creature has brought some of its subterranean magic with it!)
Surface-crawler not welcome here! These pretties belong to the dark, to the deep, to ME!

cardBonuses.2: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_FEAR} have a 3% chance to lose their turn.
cardBonuses.4: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_FEAR} have 10% less {STAT_attack}.
cardBonuses.6: Enemies with {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_FEAR} have 10% less {STAT_intelligence}.

master.dialog: Underdwellers have adapted to life in the darkest corners of the world, developing senses and powers that surface-dwellers can't comprehend! They bring the shadows with them wherever they go, bending darkness to their will. In the gloom, my Underdwellers see truths that others miss. Prepare to learn fear as only those who dwell below can teach it!
master.name: Xypher

name: Underdweller

bossDialog: (The air crackles with energy as a swirling vortex of elemental chaos forms before you, growing larger as it absorbs the ambient magic from the treasure hoard!)
(The Cataclysm manifests fully, the room darkening as it draws in all light and warmth. Even your bravest creatures hesitate before this embodiment of pure destruction!)
I am the end of all things, mortal. Your quest ends here, as will your pitiful existence!

cardBonuses.3: Your creatures have a 10% chance for their {SPELL_ultimate} Gems to not consume {STAT_charges}.
cardBonuses.7: Your creatures have a 10% chance for their {SPELL_ultimate} Gems to not consume {STAT_charges}.
cardBonuses.11: Your creatures have a 10% chance for their {SPELL_ultimate} Gems to not consume {STAT_charges}.

master.dialog: Cataclysms are living embodiments of elemental destruction. They harness forces that could end worlds, containing them within their swirling forms. As a Master of Cataclysms, I've learned to channel their chaotic energies. The secrets of the universe flow through them - and through me! Care to witness the storm that ends worlds?
master.name: Veydris

name: Cataclysm

bossDialog: (Small amphibious creatures emerge from hidden pools around the treasure, forming an organized defensive line as they croak battle cries and brandish crude but effective weapons!)
(The leader of the Mirelings puffs up its throat sac to an impossible size, unleashing a low-frequency croak that seems to shake your very bones. More of its kind emerge from the shadows!)
Swamp take you! Mud claim you! Mireling tribe protect shiny things with last breath! Attack, brothers!

cardBonuses.2: Your creatures deal 2% more damage for each unique class among your creatures.
cardBonuses.4: Your creatures deal 2% more damage for each unique class among your creatures.
cardBonuses.6: Your creatures deal 2% more damage for each unique class among your creatures.

master.dialog: Mirelings may be small, but when they work together, their swamp magic is mighty indeed! These amphibious tacticians form perfect defensive lines and coordinate their attacks with surprising precision. The secrets of the swamp belong to them - and to me as their master! Their fury might be tiny individually, but my Mireling tribe will show you the true power of the wetlands!
master.name: Glauca

name: Mireling

bossDialog: (A chorus of echoing clicks and wet thuds surrounds you as the Denizens emerge, scaling walls and slinking from unseen crevices. You instinctively step back. Too late. They're already upon you.)

(As you step closer to the treasure, a trail of saltwater slithers across the floor followed by the sloshing steps of a Denizen crawling forth from the shadows. It gurgles something in a forgotten tongue, then attacks!)

(The Denizen lurches from its murky pool with a hollow, bubbling shriek. Several others rise behind it, eyes glowing dimly like dying embers beneath the waves. You've interrupted their vigil, and now you'll pay the ultimate price.)

cardBonuses.2: Enemies take 10% more damage from their {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_MANIA} debuffs.
cardBonuses.4: Enemies take 10% more damage from their {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_MANIA} debuffs.
cardBonuses.6: Enemies take 10% more damage from their {CONDNAME_DEBUFF_MANIA} debuffs.

master.dialog: The tides do not favor the loud or the brave. They favor the patient. The still. The drowned.\n\nFight me!
master.name: Havelock

name: Denizen
